We asked for umbrellas and the hotel couldn’t provide any. For the same price, I would stay at the Sofitel or Mariott

title: Comfortabel and perfectly located.
text: Pleasant, staff was friendly but reserved, rooms were small but nice and clean. We did not use breakfast service; 30 dollar: madness. We were satisfied for the service provider to watsch over the suitcases before  leaving the hotel.

title: Best mommy daughter stay
text:
My daughter and I had the best stay with you. The room was comfortable, quiet, dark and super comfy. 
The restaurant and lounge was perfect for keeping her and her cousins busy and great for meeting up with friends after a long day shopping, museuming and just the pace of nyc. We’ll be back soon!

title: Really bad cleanliness.
text: Wont repeat any future stay in this hotel. Really bad cleanliness, too expensive for what it offers. Bad maintenance, it looks very old. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. The only good think was it’s location.

title: Excelent Location
text: Excelent location to visit the theater district in New York, nice  and quite rooms, friendly staff, nice view from the roof top bar towards Times Square, unfortunately only plastic glasses on outside part and queuing for breakfast

title: Localisation parfaite
text: L’hôtel est parfaitement situé au cœur de Manhattan. La déco du lobby et de l’espace lounge est très sympa et une belle vue sur Times square depuis la terrasse et le restaurant. Je déplore quand même la taille des lits que je trouve très petite pour 2 personnes adultes.

title: 29 Nights in M Social
text:
As part of a business trip, I’d stayed for 29 nights at M Social Times Square New York on the 14th floor. I want to give a big shoutout to my cleaning lady - Luiza - who made and cleaned my room everyday without fail. She was attentive to detail and ensured that the room was always clean, and the beds always made. Whenever I’d meet her in the hallway, she was always smiling and very personable. For the next time I’m back in NYC, I would personally request to stay on the 14th floor again - all because of Luiza. The hotel would do very well to keep and reward her as a valued staff.

In addition, I want to give a big shoutout to Alvin Wright working at the front desk. He usually does the morning shifts until 3PM daily, and he’s been an absolute pleasure to liaise with. He’s always helpful, willing to go the extra mile, and handles all types of questions in a positive manner. His attitude and mannerism is what all front desk staff should aspire towards. Because of my lengthy stay, I’d naturally have a couple of situations to deal with, and I only wanted to speak with Alvin because I knew I could get an effective and decisive resolution. The hotel would do very well to keep and reward him as a valued staff.

It’d be much appreciated that the General Manager receives and reads this, and cascades the feedback to the wider team.

title: Posizione top! Struttura da consigliare
text:
Abbiamo alloggiato per 6 notti (una mamma con due figli adolescenti) in una camera Social Premier con 2 letti alla francese e vista su Times Square. L'extra pagato per avere la vista è stato ben speso a mio avviso.
Non abbiamo usufruito della colazione in hotel (30 dollari + tasse a testa) 

FATTORI POSITIVI: La posizione è spettacolare, proprio in Times Square, comoda per raggiungere i principali punti di interesse sia a piedi che con la subway. La camera è piccolina ma siamo a NY, non si può pretendere troppo! Gli arredi sono nuovi e in ordine, l'armadio è abbastanza capiente, il bagno nuovo e pulito, la doccia gigante, in generale abbiamo trovato una buona pulizia e la camera ci è stata sistemata puntualmente tutti i giorni.
Molto carino anche il bar all'interno dell'hotel con un bellissimo rooftop panoramico, il conto è salato, come del resto dappertutto a NY.
Ottimo il servizio gratuito per il deposito dei bagagli prima del check in o dopo il check out.

FATTORI NEGATIVI: L'accoglienza al check in è stata deludente. Dicevano che la mia carta di credito non funzionava ma avevo letto altre recensioni e sapevo che era successo ad altri ospiti quindi non mi sono fatta prendere dal panico, non ho detto che avevo altre carte ma ho insistito e alla fine la carta miracolosamente ha funzionato. Preciso che ho usato la stessa carta ovunque per una settimana e non ho mai avuto problemi.
Peccato per i vetri delle finestre che erano sporchi e un pò rovinavano la vista su Times Square, ma posso immaginare che non sia facile tenerli puliti soprattutto in un periodo in cui piove spesso

In generale la struttura è da consigliare!

title: Nice place
text:
Expérience de 5 nuits, depuis le changement de fanion du Novotel > millenium il y a une petite perte de qualité en général.
Mais l'emplacement reste remarquable et les employés également               
Bye bye nyc !

title: Excellent Location, nice vibes
text:
Excellent location, next to times square yet a bit far from the noisy square. friendly and professional  staff. The hotel is vibrant, the bar at the lobby is alive all nights and the outside terrace with the view on times square is really nice for an end of day drink. 

Long waiting time for elevator

title: EXCELLENT
text:
Juste changer d'hôtesse à l'accueil , personne cheveux frisés , peau noire la quarantaine , vraiment désagréable , je préfererais avoir une borne automatique .... 
Sinon excellent dans tous les domaines cet hôtel

title: Pretty Solid Midtown Hotel
text: Booked a room on Hotel Tonight for a last-minute work event. Totally decent hotel. Barely spent time there, but the room seemed very clean and the bed was surprisingly comfortable. All the staff I interacted with were really nice. Kind of a funky location, but if you're looking for an affordable springboard to see a lot of touristy stuff, you could do way worse. And most importantly, the hotel felt clean! FYI, they charge a $40 resort fee AFTER you check out -- it wasn't included in my original price quote.

title: Bon emplacement mais rapport qualité/prix ne correspond pas à un 4 étoiles
text:
Nous nous sommes rendus en couple avec un enfant dans cet hôtel pendant 6 jours. Points positif : 
L'hôtel est très bien placé à Times Square. La vue depuis le restaurant. 
Le personnel au déjeuné et le petit-déjeuné était bon mais cependant pas très varié.
Femme de méage très sympatique
Check-out rapide 
Joli Lobby avec babyfoot , TV switch, animations soirées

Points négatifs : 
L'accueil lors du check-in, la dame était antipathique, exécrable pas à l'écoute je n0ai jamais vu ça pour un 4 étoiles. Check-in expéditif.  ATTENTION l'hôtel vous charges 100USD par nuit environ + TAXE  jusqu'au check-out MAUVAISE SURPRISE lorsque nous sommes arrivés sur place et la personne a l'accueil ne nous a meme pas prévenu, nous nous sommes rendus compte lorsque nous avons vérifié notre compte bancaire. Si vous avez un budget précis il faut prévoir sinon vous allez vous retrouver dans la M****! Heureusement que nous avions compté large. De plus il n'y a pas de mini-bar un frigo mais vide...
La chambre était correct. mais il y avait des trous dans le mur et des traces en ce qui concerne la douche, elle etait propre mais mal entretenue pas digne d'un 4 étoiles. Il n'y avait pas pas de produits usuel comme un kit avec coton-tige/coton démaquillant ni verre à dent , juste un petit carré de savon... très limite.
Si vous souhaitez vous rendre au petit-déjeuné le matin, évitez d'y aller à 9h00 tous les ascenseurs sont pleins nous avons souvent attendu une dizaine de min puis finalement nous passions par les escaliers. 
Pour finir si vous souhaitez une belle vue, les étages commencent à partir du niveau 9-10 demandez une vue à partir du 20ème étage. Honnetement je n'y retournerais pas je penses qu'il y a des autres hôtels qui valent plus la peine.

title: Poucos elevadores com demora para subir
text: Bem localizado se você deseja ficar na Times Square, porém se você deseja locais mais tranquilos procure outro, ck in muito tarde (16h) e não adianta solicitar mais cedo pois eles não liberam, quarto ok porém camas com colchão muito mole. Precisa pegar dois elevadores para chegar no quarto e a depender do horário espera muito pois são poucos e com muita. muita gente

title: Quick nyc stay
text: The only negatives were the bed and the room temp. Beds were a little hard and uneven. Room temp was too high even when we had the ac turned all the way down! Everyone at the hotel was so helpful and nice. Luggage check was awesome and front desk was welcoming and nice. Felt safe and secure the whole time and the location of the hotel was amazing.

title: Room with Times Square view
text: Stayed only one night to experiment what should have been a memorable experience in this hotel with a view and rooftop. We paid for a 3 person bedroom with extra view. The beds are very comfortable but are quite small (140) for a 4* hotel. We woul have prefer a single plus a large beds instead of two medium. The bedroom is also overall small, but nothing compared to the bath: rather a big shower than an actual bath. Very noisy air conditioning.

title: M Social Hotel Experience
text: Would absolutely recommend this hotel for anyone that is wanted to state and times square of new york period. Great place to bring the family for vacation or even if you just in the city for business. Prime location to see the ball drop for new year's!

title: Disappointed
text: I was charged an extra $100 to check in at 12:30.  The pictures of the rooms are a lot nicer on the website.  They are old and tired.  No seating area.  Dirty walls.  I was overcharged on my final bill and have not heard back from the hotel yet, its been 3 days/ Plus side, great location.

title: New York with Teenagers
text:
Excellent location, nice decoration, very good bed and bathroom, amazing bar and balcony over Times Square. Will come back for sure and reccomend to friends.
Could improve on cleanning and breakfast variety.

title: Ideal location
text: Would be a little bit more convenient if check in was earlier. The room was as described. The staff was courteous and helpful. I had a little issue but Yvonne did a very good job taking care of it for me .

title: Theatre Group Looking Forward to Next Trip
text: The theatre group that I booked at the M Social Times Square couldn't have been more pleased. The location was convenient and accommodations were excellent. It was a pleasure working with Lorenzo and Natasha with this group. Thank you !

title: La plus belle vue de Times Square
text:
Service extrêmement long
Les plats ne sont pas exceptionnels 
Les prix sont élevés mais c’est certainement la plus belle vue de Times Square
Fabuleux !!!
Apéro en extérieur sur le roof top puis dîner avec une vue inoubliable.
Je conseille pour boire un verre mais pas forcément pour y dîner

title: Buen hotel
text: Buen hotel. Buena ubicación cerca del times square, del subte. De la mayoría de la atracciónes de manhattan . No tanto del soho, village o puente de Brooklyn. Aunque si te gusta caminar no hay problema . No es un hotel lujoso , pero es limpio y las habitaciones son más grandes de lo habitual de NY.  Tampoco me salió caro por lo q ofrece .

title: Bonne expérience
text: Hôtel très bien situé et très joli. Assez cher. Pdj et dîner hors de prix. Personnel à la réception pas très accueillant. En revanche très bon service de conciergerie. Je recommande pour sa localisation et sa vue sur times square.

title: Overnight in NYC with Teen
text:
M Social
Times Square NYC
My daughter and I arrived around 1.30pm on a Thursday.
We were able to check in
Just to be clear this hotel normally charges a fee for anything prior to 4:00pm
I want to say I’ve stayed a lot of hotels in NYC.  Certainly, check out the other hotels we've stayed in if you are trying to pick a hotel.  Most hotels check in is at 3:00pm
If you arrive early and your room is ready they may let you check in without a fee

We were greeted by Flora
She gave us the  hotel information
Their resort fee includes:
Wifi
$10.00 beverage credit only at the bar
Citi bike comp for a free rides
Bag Storage-Which now some hotels are charging

When you arrive to the hotel you take the elevator from the ground floor  to the lobby
The lobby is bright and busy. There are games for the adults as well as kids
They have places to sit and chill
The best thing about the lobby is they have a wrap around deck to sit, drink , eat and people watch in Times Square    Stunning at night! 

We also met Alvin at the front desk. He was very informative.

Our room overlooked times square
King room. Small refrigerator. The room was very clean. They have a rain shower facet that was amazing. The bath products were wonderful. It is very basic no body lotion or Keurig. You can get both if you ask.
We traveled by bus due to quick planning. We walked from the Port Authority which is a good 15 minutes walk.  There are other hotels that say Times Square which are closer to Penn Station and Port Authority
They have a fitness center which we didn’t use
Overall for the location I would stay here again
Good trip

title: Good value hotel in a great location
text: As NYC hotels go, this was very good value. Location was great. Rooms spacious and very good breakfast. Hotel spotless and lobby was very trendy. Nice addition of rooftop balcony/terrace. Would definitely stay again if I return.

title: Colorado mom enjoying Times Square
text: I met my son in Times Square who was in town for a senior trip He stayed at the MSocial Hotel with his classmates and it was the perfect place. It was close to Times Square, several restaurants and Broadway. The staff was great, the rooms comfortable and clean, and my view of the Hudson River was spectacular! I will definitely be back.

title: Great hotel.  Perfect location and amazing staff
text:
The location is great.  Amazing staff and facilities.  Very comfortable rooms 
Breakfast was very nice and the variety very good. Bar at night very nice with music at restaurant.  Rooftop had great views and ambiance

title: New York Break
text: This is a great hotel given New York is full of 'smallish room' hotels that charge a lot of not so much.  There's a great lobby space and fantastic views of Times Square.  2 different subway stops within a block to all the spots.

title: Amazing stay!
text: We are a family of four. We really enjoyed our stay. Easy drive to the hotel, convinient parking next to the hotel. Amazing prime location. Friendly and helpful staff. Memorable vibe and ambiance on the main level and unbelivable terrasse facing Time Square. We loved our stay and cannot wait to go back!!!!!

title: very good experience - Times Square
text: This was very good experience at Times Square. close to many attractions and easy to arrive and depart. the view was very nice from the terrace if you like the city life. metro stations are all around.

title: NY
text:
Tutto perfetto! Camera bella e con vista Times Square ,personale gentile, servizi eccellenti, colazione ottima con vista, terrazzo bellissimo per aperitivo,
camera pulita. Posizione ottima per visitare la città

title: Times Square View
text: Great location. Lobby has a beautiful view and very comfortable. Elevators are crowded. Restaurant food was good but not much variety. Staff in all areas were helpful and friendly. View from the room was great

title: Very average
text: It is a very average hotel.  Lobby area is noisy and crowded most of the time including the bar/restaurant.  There was a surprise "resort fee" but I really don't know what it was for, there are no resort amenities (only a work out room, no pool, sauna, hot tub, etc).  The hotel is showing signs of wear both inside and outside.  The lint filter on the hair dryer was completely clogged, both a hazard to the dryer and a fire hazard.  There was also an accumulation of dust and lint on some of the exercise equipment.  The best feature of the  hotel was its location.  Really overpriced even for New York.

title: should have been so much better
text:
I booked a room for 3 people but when we got in our room there were 2 small beds so it was obvious all 3 of us were not going to fit. I went to reception and had to spend another $1477 getting another room. Ironically if our room bed had been the same size as the one in the other room we would not have needed an additional room!! 
Also before our visit, we received an email asking if we would like to upgrade if there was availability. We replied saying yes then received a further message saying at check-in we would be told if there had been an upgrade applied or not and we had to accept it or decline it there and then. There was no mention of an upgrade being applied and obviously as mentioned our room was not adequate in the first place and the view was of the office block over the road so we still had no idea we had been upgraded!!! On checking the invoice after we left it looks like we were charged $35 per day for an upgrade we never authorized.....and bizarrely enough the extra room we paid for was miles better than the so-called upgraded room!! We should also have had $10 deducted for each room off our bills for spending at the bar which we never received!!

title: Great Time at Times Square
text: Heading for breakfast you are getting overwhelmed by Time Square View from upper Broadway and therefore especially unique because of its oblique course. The whole lobby, bar and restaurant are very stylish and of cool Atmosphäre reflecting somehow Time Square again. No way to find a quiet and reverent place. For what?

title: great experience
text: Very nice and fancy hotel just a couple of steps from Times Square. Great location will enable you to explore NYC on foot. Despite heavy traffic around, we could sleep very well and the room was quite. Hope to come back again.

title: READY TO GO BACK!
text: This hotel was amazing, the location was perfect and the view from our room on the 32nd floor was spectacular. The room was big enough to accommodate my family(me, my husband, and baby) and we were able to request a pack n play and microwave be sent to our room. Alvin at the front desk was an absolute gem. He was extremely polite not just at check in but every single time we walked through the lobby. our flight was cancelled the day we were supposed to leave. we were in a panic but Alvin went above and beyond to help us reserve the room for an extra night which wasn't the easiest thing to do seeing as this was the weekend and the room we had was in high demand. no need to research hotels on our next trip to NYC, we have to stay at M Social! Can't wait to return and we really hope we get to see Alvin again!

title: NYC Trip
text: We enjoyed the location and had NO issues with the elevators at all.  We stayed in a Social Deluxe that had an amazing view of Times Square. The gift shop has a great selection of drinks and snacks. In the evening the lobby had music and a cool vibe. The rooftop bar view is amazing!

title: Great experience
text: The hotel is right in the heart of Times Square and I would highly recommend this hotel. I already told my family to stay there. Me and my wife will be staying there every time we go to New York. Easy check-in and check-out

title: Excellent experience
text: The location of the hotel was great. Probably one of the best place in Times Square. Restaurant very close by is the time in squares experience. Everything Rockefeller Centre, museums, train stations everything right there close to you. The stay make the New York experience great

title: very pleasant trip in New York
text: The hotel is very well located, near several subway stations, in times square. No noise. We recommand this hotel. Possible to have breakfast, and restaurant. We enjoyed this trip. The bedroom is large.

title: Très bonne expérience
text:
L'hôtel est très bien situé proche du métro et des monuments. Nous avons principalement traverser NYC à pied. Les chambres ont une belle vue sur Times Square et le bar est agréable. 
Je recommande pour un séjour.

title: Lovely hotel, beat location
text: We enjoyed our stay at the hotel. We like the location most because it is so central and quiet at the same time. The breakfast was a bit boring after we have had same food three times, luckily the Angelina Bakery just outside the hotel offers good sandwiches and delicious Italian cakes. You must try the 🍰

title: Awesome hotel Perfect location
text: You couldn't ask for a better hotel in a better location if Times Square is where you want to be! Room size is good. Clean. Friendly staff. Walking distance to so much! I'll stay here when I return to NYC

title: Location and social
text: Very good location and a large area for social gathering at the lobby. Food and drinks are available for breakfast and later on, as well as a small grocery store. A very good ambiance for families and very close to shows.

title: best hotel ever!
text: I would book this hotel again as the location was great, not noisy at all and perfect walking distance to time square (5 mins)!! staff was very friendly and hotel was beautiful with a great lobby and roof top for a nice hangout with friends and family! I would definitely come back to this hotel

title: Perfect for our one night stay after a cruise and right in the middle of broadway
text:
We arrived well before the 4:00p check-in. The bellman took our bags with no fuss. We were traveling with my mother-in-law so it was great that so many things were about a block away -- including the Starlight diner and at least 4 broadway plays. It's just far enough from the core of time square to keep you out of the hustle and bustle but close enough to everything you'd want in a broadway / time square hotel.

The lobby is especially impressive. They have a nice balcony to look around and several games for kids and adults alike to play. 

The rooms were very nice and roomy. We happened to have a nice view of times square which was a nice bonus.

title: Great Experience - Will Stay Again!
text: This hotel was perfect for my teenager daughter and I! The room looked exactly like the photos. Very clean. Great lobby and rooftop bar overlooking Times Square. The location couldn't be better! I had stayed at a different hotel a few years earlier that was not half as nice and was the same price. Now that I've found the M Social Hotel Times Square, I will use it from now on! Highly recommend.

title: Nice room mids staff
text: never recieved my bill and they just charged my card.. Called and a day later still have not received it. Asian lady was rude to me at the front desk when checking in. Room was adequate but had a creaking noise for most of the night that was unpleasant for me and my partner. Was very packed and they had fees that were unexpected.

title: M Social Times Square Easter 2023
text: Location close to the Times Square is great. The social area with a kicker close to the lobby provided a great atmosphere. The restaurant and the bar offered good quality food at decent prices. Overall an excellent experience.

title: Cozy and Modern
text: My 12 year old and I stayed here in April 2023 and loved it! We requested a high floor and we’re given the 33rd! The room is cozy and has lots of storage and a comfortable bed. The lobby is both soothing and buzzing with activity. There is a large TV hooked up to a gaming console in front of a couch where children gather to meet and play Mario Kart…super awesome idea! The rooftop patio is amazing. Not actually a restaurant so you can bring your food out there from other places and just sit and look up over timessquare. We did not take advantage of the breakfast because it was $30 per person. But there is a mini fridge in the room so we just filled it with yogurts and fruits from a local bodega. We were able to do all of our sightseeing by foot from the MSocial for our short trip: Rockefeller Center, Central Park, Empire State building, and, of course Phantom of the opera which was the main reason we came to the city, we also enjoyed Madame Tussaud’s wax Museum, which is nearby the hotel. When we got to the hotel our room wasn’t ready so we went there while we waited and had an absolute blast! (They held our bags for us)We will definitely book a room here when we come back!

title: Top ! Emplacement et établissement
text:
Accueil chaleureux, très bon service. 
Un bel établissement, jolie décoration. La terrasse offre une vue sur Time Square (tout comme l’espace du petit déjeuner/buffet). La chambre est très agréable, bonne literie et salle de bain agréable (bonne pression de l’eau 😉). 
Un emplacement idéal pour profiter, visiter NYC ! Je recommande !

title: Wonderful hotel fantastic location and atmosphere
text: We had an amazing 5 night stay at the hotel . Wonderful location  amd atmosphere very friendly staff. Only negative was service at the bar/restaurant was really slow both during day and at night. Would recommend hotel to friends and family tho as everything else was faultless

title: Good Stay for the Area
text: The room was decently sized, the view was great. The only issue I had was the shower would completely turn off in the middle of showering. It would turn on about 5 seconds later but it was not a pleasant experience. The bar always had people at it and the  live music on Thursday night is great.

title: Bonne semaine dans cet hôtel
text: Hôtel très bien situé, personnel disponible agréable et souriant, prestations de qualité ceci dit pour le prix de la semaine c'est normal. Seul bémol : pas possible de payer la chambre à la réservtion sur internet. Mais super séjour

title: Excellent
text:
We really enjoyed our trip in M-Social Times Square, the location is perfect and the bedrooms very comfortable. I will certainly return here!
One minor point : there is no coffee machine in the bedroom

title: Great experience with business group at hotel!
text: I brought a group to stay at M Social for a business event and it was a positive experience. I worked with Lorenzo and Rosa and they made things easy to navigate and set up. They were thorough and responsive. Thank you!

title: Great location, lovely stay
text: Cute rooms, very helpful staff. We had some issues with the TV remote and blankets that were met quickly. Breakfast is common, lack of vegtables and variety but ok. Hotel has great location close to times square, subway, shops, central park and some more attractions

title: M Social Review- Chalon Entertainment
text: Excellent! Perfect and Convenient location. We stayed there so that we could close to the Neil Simon Theater as were there to celebrate Myles Frost.  MSocial is awesome! The staff went above !  Thank you M Social.

title: Hôtel idéalement situé près Times Square
text:
Hôtel très bien situé près de Time square et calme malgré tout. 
Chambre spacieuse et lit très confortable .
Un peu d attente aux ascenseurs mais ça allait.
Bar avec vue sur Times Square et ambiance avec musique dans l hôtel. 
Nous avons passé 3 nuits superbes dans cet hôtel.

title: Excellent location with spectacular views
text: I would definitely stay here again, the views were incredible, our room looked right into Times to Square. The hotel bar was great and the location was amazing, we had planned to see Wicked and we could see the theatre from our room!

title: So much for a chill first evening.
text: Well I just got here today; things can only improve.  Check-in went smoothly.  Got up to my to my room on the 29th floor.  No complaints on the elevators.  Nice view.  Unpacked (I hate living out of a suitcase.). White bedspread had lots of black particles of some sort on it, that I just brushed off.  No biggie.  Turned on the tv to relax and watch the news, ordered room service.  That was delivered and WHAM, the tv stopped working.  Maintenance couldn’t figure out the problem after putzing with it for 30 mins.  I was told I would need to go without tv or change to a different room.  Ugh.  Went back down to registration, waited for 10 mins, got keys for a new room, back upstairs to re-pack everything, then had to make two trips to move my luggage, and my dinner, from the old room to the new room.  By the time I settled down to eat my supper (Caesar salad), the dressing had caused the lettuce and the croutons to become soggy.  Not the least bit appetizing.  Fingers crossed that the next 4 days are better

title: Great hotel - definitely recommend
text: Fantastic light and spacious lobby area, unusual in NYC. Great service and much larger than usual rooms in NYC. Quiet and calm despite being so central / near Times Square. You can jog to Central Park! I will definitely return for future business / fun trips.

title: Close to Broadway and Times Square
text: If you are looking for convenience to Broadway, Time Square and want to have a good time, MSocial is your hotel.  The staff is extremely friendly and helpful.  The restaurant is opened for breakfast, lunch and dinner.  The bar and lobby lounge offers a nice place to relax and take a break.  A very nice stay.

title: Great situation and comfortable room
text: A very good place. The view in the room and in the fitness were perfect. The room and the bed very comfortable. Little bit noisy sometimes but most of the time it was okay. I recommand this hotel if you don't spend too much time inside (a lot of waitinf for the elevators).The bar and the service were excellent.

title: Great location!
text: I loved the location of the hotel - it is a stone's throw away from bustling Times Square but slightly off a corner so you are not immersed in a crowd every time you go out.  There is a supermarket right at the ground floor and that is really good.   I liked the vibrant lounge area with its music and the $10 credit for a drink every day of the stay per room.   The staff was helpful and tried to let us have our room early.  The room is a good size and clean.  I liked that the hotel provided a coffee machine and kettle (on request) but I was disappointed there was no water provided.   The lift situation was not great.  The lifts are always packed and rather slow but you had to stop at level 5 then changed lift to the ground level.  That was rather inconvenient.  But for the price and location,   I would stay here again.

title: Good location, quiet room with a great view - shame about the lifts
text:
Decent hotel - but tired in terms of decor, particularly in the bathroom. But a great view (we had a river view room on the 33rd floor). Great nights sleep, nice and quiet. Staff were lovely - especially in the restaurant at breakfast and housekeeping. 

Unfortunately during the 5 days we stayed only 2 of the 4 lifts worked, which meant a lot of waiting around. 

But excellent location, and it looked like they were starting to refurbish the rooms - so would recommend.

title: Brilliant Hotel and location.
text:
M Aocial is in a brilliant location at Times Square. All in the hotel was excellent. Staff were all brilliant, very friendly and welcoming from reception to housekeeping especially Esley!). 
 The elevators were however awful!! There are four elevators but at most there only ever two actually working which meant because they were also very, very slow they were also very very congested. Millennium Hotels really need to sort this out.

title: Μια αξέχαστη εμπειρία!!!
text: Το ξενοδοχείο  ήταν πολύ καλό,  πολύ καλη τοποθεσια δίπλα στην times Square.Το δωμάτιο ήταν άνετο με μεγάλα κρεβάτια, το προσωπικό  ήταν  ευγενεστατο και κυρίως  η κυρία  Βαλεντίνα που μας διατηρούσε τα δωμάτια  πεντακάθαρα!Κυρία  Βαλεντίνα  σας ευχαριστούμε  για όλα,εύχομαι  να σας ξαναδούμε!!!

title: Simply Amazing, Great Location!
text: very well located + pretty views from times square, staff was so nice at all times, and the room was very comfy! definitely recommend for short or long stays, and make sure you go to the small convenience store inside the hotel for some NY souvenirs :D

title: DO NOT USE EXPRESS CHECK OUT
text: Unauthorized dining charges, cleanliness, and customer service are just a few of the reasons that I would not stay at this hotel.  Whether your traveling for business or pleasure there are much better accomadations available for the same rate.

title: Good option
text:
Clean with a great location, great view and good breakfast.
The staff was very polite and useful in giving all kind of information.
Elevators were the only problem with only 2 out of 4 working which means up to 10 minutes queue just to get one.

title: Perfect stay!
text: So happy with this decision.  What a spectacular location.  MJ and Funny Girl right next door and across the street.  All theaters in quick walking distance.  Rockefeller walking in 5 minutes.  Tons of restaurant options.  Felt safe throughout a week long stay.  Staff was attentive.  Rooms were not typical NY tiny but just right.

title: Great hotel
text: This was our first time staying there. The room was large and clean.  The outside restaurant area and bar area was a lot of fun.  I can't say enough about how great the staff was.  We will definitely stay there again.

title: Highly recommend
text: First time staying here. Loved the hotel. The view was great, the food, especially the buffet ,was terrific. However the best part of the stay was the staff.  Every one we interacted with was friendly , knowledgeable and polite. Edward M. Was particularly helpful with our last requests.

title: Nothing in the room
text:
After spending $500
Per room there was not even bottled water in the room no toiletries bathrooms empty. When we checked in they did not have our reservation and made us feel like it’s my mistake after I proved it they gave us a room, but at this point my mood was ruined

title: TREMENDO !
text:
La scortesia è ciò che più caratterizza questo “hotel”.
In tutta la mia vita non ho mai incontrato una receptionist più antipatica, sgarbata e scortese.
La hall era estremamente caotica, hotel rumorosissimo, per non parlare delle code chilometriche per utilizzare gli ascensori.
Per concludere, hanno diversi problemi con le carte di credito.
State alla larga da questo posto che NY è piena di hotel validissimi dove sanno trattare i clienti.

title: Great lobby and great location
text: Was here with a group from a University. Easy check in. Nice rooms. The highlight is the amazing upper lobby/bar area. It is spacious, comfortable, has games and outside space. Only complaint was long waits for elevators and an understaffed bar.

title: Great location, good room & great views!
text:
Location is absolutely perfect, close to all the big midtown sights and 5/10 minute walk to Central Park. Lots of restaurants, bars and deli’s nearby and close subway stations.  
Bed was super comfy and great view from our Hudson view room on the 30th floor. 
The bar/lounge/terrace is a great place to relax with a drink, good lively music played all day and a fabulous view of Times Square from the terrace!
We didn’t have breakfast at the hotel, this seemed quite expensive at $30 each per day. Instead we tried various nearby coffee houses and deli’s everyday which is our preference when on holiday anyway.
Would definitely stay here again!

title: Excellent location
text: The hotel has good reviews so I booked it for that reason. So far it has been a great experience staying at MSocial Hotel. It’s close to the places where we planned to go. It has a lot of restaurants nearby and subway stations are pretty near not to mention the attractions are walking distance. The room itself is quiet I haven’t heard any sound from   next door even the street sounds like sirens are very muffled. Our room has the Times Square view it’s beautiful to look at during the night.

title: Prime location and trendy
text: The hotel is in a prime location. The aesthetics are a great vibe. The amenities are cool especially if you plan on using them. The cost was not too bad. I was a little disappointed at the way my mattress looked however... ultra stained around the sides (brown and yellow looking stains). The view of time square was nice. I also had a tiny peek-a-boo view of the Hudson. I would stay here again.

title: NON ANDATE IN QUESTO POSTO
text:
Dopo aver prenotato direttamente sul sito dell’hotel essendo un membro della catena Millenium mi sono presentata alla reception, dove una donna sgarbata ed arrogante ha chiesto i documenti di tutta la mia famiglia senza nemmeno salutare dopo di che ha chiesto una carta di credito per l’addebito della cauzione. Purtroppo nessuna delle nostre tre carte veniva accettata con la motivazione del PIN digitato erroneamente (da  tutti  i titolari delle carte?!?!) . Ci hanno fatto fare due tentativi ma nessuno è andato a buon fine, ho telefonato alla mia banca che mi ha assicurato che non vi era nessun malfunzionamento e che in assoluto c’era disponibilità. Visto che comunque non riuscivamo a utilizzare questo metodo di pagamento abbiamo chiesto la possibilità di pagare almeno una notte in contanti anche perché ormai era sera. Questa richiesta è stata rifiutata e ci hanno letteralmente mandato via dicendo che a loro non importava niente e che non era un problema che li riguardasse. Abbiamo chiesto se almeno ci potessero dare la connessione Wi-Fi per cercare un altro hotel, ma la risposta è stata un NO secco dicendoci nuovamente di andarcene. 
Io e la mia famiglia ci siamo ritrovati per strada, stanchi dal lungo viaggio e senza conoscere la città con la disperazione di non sapere cosa fare.
Fortunatamente abbiamo trovato nelle vicinanze un altro hotel, molto bello pulito e meno caro e che soprattutto ha accettato il pagamento con la mia carta di credito, che poi abbiamo usato per tutta la vacanza dandoci la certezza che fosse stato mal funzionante il loro pos.
NON SONO MAI STATA TRATTATA COSÌ MALE COME IN QUESTO ALBERGO. 
Da evitare assolutamente perché se dovesse capitare la stessa situazione ad altri clienti verrebbero buttati per strada come è successo a noi. Ripeto le carte di credito erano funzionanti!!!!! Statevene alla larga da questi maleducati

title: Avena the Great!!
text: Just wanted to give a huge shout out to Avena, she was absolutely amazing!! She treated my kids (3teens) like family and was a joy to see every morning!! Thank you for making our trip even more special!!

title: Great location, great staff
text: We booked only knowing we were close to Times Square. The staff was very accommodating with our reservation adjustments and needs that occurred during our stay. They went out of their way to fix a minor issue in our room, and provided good information for transportation and things to see while we were there. The view of Times Square from our room was amazing and we were within two blocks of all the excitement. It did take a while to get our luggage upon departure, but we will just skip that amenity next time. I would absolutely stay at this hotel again.

title: Service is underpar for price
text: We paid a steep price for these rooms, and although the rooms are big and nice, and loved the location, the service was disappointing. We had a broken toilet for over a day that was not taken care of, ice machine was broken on our floor (you can't get to other floors without a key), andwere treated rudely at the dining room and check-in desk.  For this price, stay somewhere else.

title: ELEVATORS!!!!
text:
Very disappointing visit! Not all elevators working, resulting in long waits.
Not having a coffee maker in the room or free coffee in the lobby ( at least in the morning) was a pain.
The gift shop is an incredible rip-off!
Coming back to NYC in July...not staying here!

title: Excellent hotel for theatre district
text: We stay at M Social every time we visit NYC.  Great value for the price. Comfortable beds and pillows, blackout curtains, in room fridge and can request a microwave.  Plenty of room for the two of us.  Great location to see Broadway shows, TKTS booth is an easy walk, Duane Reade at the corner.

title: Great location and room, slow elevators.
text: Great stay at M Social Hotel in NYC. Only stayed one night but really enjoyed it. Fantastic location, easy check in and very comfortable and clean room. The one issue is the elevators. They are wildly slow and cannot handle the volume of people staying at the hotel. Took 15-20 mins to get downstairs then to line up for another elevator to get out. I ended up taking my bags down the stairs when checking out. The lounge downstairs looks amazing, wish I had a moment to enjoy it,

title: Great location, spacious rooms ( for NYC)
text: Great location, larger than expected room ( for New York). Rooms were very comfortable and staff was excellent. Walking distance to shopping, restaurants, and shows. Close to subway stops too! Would stay here again!

title: Stylish hotel in a wonderful location
text: We really liked this hotel. The room was clean and has a mini fridge. The room was large by NYC standards and quiet on our 16th floor location. The hotel location is wonderful, close to Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center and subway access.  The lobby is very comfy.  Keeping it from 5 stars for me:  the elevators were too slow, we always waited quite a while to get an elevator, sometimes fairly large groups would be waiting for an elevator and the waits detracted from our hotel experience.  Another item was they should get rid of dining service at the three small tables and two sofas and leave those open for general lobby seating and hanging out. Too many  times we wanted to just chill in the lobby with our coffee and couldn't sit because they were for dining customers. Lastly, while most of the staff were very attentive, some of the staff seemed to lack a spark for customer service.  The outside deck is as amazing as it looks in the photos.

title: Beware.
text: BEWARE, BEWARE, BEWARE!!!!! Upon arrival the hotel asked for $100/night holding fee which upon checkout would be credited back on my card… I have rang asking where my money is and was told it can take between 5 and 10 working days and they confirmed they have released the payment. I spoke to my credit card company who tell me it hasn't been released yet, and that it has a hold of 30 days. 10 days later I am still waiting. Shocking, truly shocking.

title: Best stay for the location!
text: Overall the hotel was in the perfect location (very central so where we wanted to travel around to with 2 kids), amazing view and you couldn’t beat the price. Elevator was a daily issue. Only 2 working elevators which made waiting for one a 5 minute deal… and you MUST have your room card ready right away to select your floor. And if you don’t, your an even longer elevator ride. Rooms could have been a little cleaner, but wasn’t bad at all (just visible spills and dirt on cabinets)- beds were clean. They only offer a buffet for breakfast which I did not like- buffet was mediocre, more like a holiday inn as far as quality… however I love to find local spots for breakfast anyways (Stardust is literally around the corner!) so this was no care to me, my kids enjoyed it though (what kids don’t like a buffet). Staff was super friendly. Bar was lively at night with great music and drinks were phenomenal- bartenders could all make a delicious drink! Double beds are full size. Which made it not so comfortable at night. But for 3 nights it was bearable. We will be back! The location was got me.

title: Outstanding Hotel in Ideal Location
text: Our family loved our stay at M Social. Staff were superb and the hotel has a really fun vibe. Breakfasts were delicious and housekeeping was excellent. Fun games in the lobby for the kids and parents. Highly recommended!!

title: Outstanding Establishment
text: I came for my birthday and everything from the location, cleanliness and atmosphere to the safety features and service was outstanding! I was a bit upset about the booking price changing during online booking but it was still a good rate. I will definitely stay again!

title: La peor experiencia que he tenido en mi vida un lugar al que no volvería , el personal es grosero y racista
text: La peor experiencia que he tenido en mi vida un lugar al que no volvería , el personal es grosero y racista. Me siento vulnerado por ser latino , el personal del front desk fue agresivo por no entender inglés

title: Amazing Hotel Experience
text: We recently stayed at the M Social Times Square and couldn't be happier.  The location of the hotel is perfect, less then a 5 minute walk to the center of everything.  It's right on the subway so getting to and from the hotel is wicked easy.  The staff was on point, the vibe of the lobby and lounge area was super cool and the views on the patio are some of the best you can get in Times Square.  Killer experience, I can't wait to go back!

title: Excellent all around!
text: Would definitely recommend! The ambiance was beautiful, modern but homey. Staff was friendly and attentive and check in and check went smooth. Comfortable rooms and walking distance to many attraction, will definitely be back!

title: Great Hotel in Times Square
text: Comfortable room, Food and drinks were great, Staff was very helpful, Located in the middle of Everything.  Bags can be checked before check-in giving you the option to start your New York City visit right away.

title: Stayed here several times when it was NovoTel
text:
Having stayed here before it changes to the M Social, I thought to come again.
After long flight and 2 months of staying in hotels all around the world.
This was the only Hotel that said I could check in before 4.00 pm but only if I paid them $100.00.
This has made our journey quite long and to be honest I’d strongly suggest another place to stay if your hoping to check in before 4.00 pm.
Very disappointed at the welcome.

title: Holiday
text: Nice hotel!! Good view over Times Square. We had a very pleasant stay. Clean Room, nice beds and great lobbey! Nice staff and perfect location. The price per day was fine. Because of the hotel our trip was even greater

title: A Wonderful Night in Times Square
text: The M Social Hotel was more than we had imagined.  The location was perfect.  We walked about two buildings down to Gallagher's Steak House, which was reasonably priced with delicious food.  The waiter, Daniel, was excellent.  After dinner, we were able to walk a few buildings down to the Neil Simon Theater to see the musical, MJ, which was EXCEPTIONAL! It was one of the best musicals I have ever seen!  We traveled by Amtrak, which was offering a reduced rate for that day, which was a bargain.  Who would imagine traveling to New York for less than $60 round trip? Thank you for the opportunity to share my comments about this OUTSTANDING outing!

title: Hotel Gem of NYC
text: M Social has the views but also the best staff. Staff treat you like a friend and they are organized. Beast & Butterfly has epic service & delicious food! This is such a great value for your money- I can't recommend this Hotel enough- it was the best time of my life!

title: In the heart of the action!
text: I agonized over picking a hotel for our hotel trip. I did not want to be too far from the action! This was my first time in NYC and knew I wanted to be in an area where we could walk to most tourist locations. I had a friend in NYC the week before my trip and she was staying at this hotel. With her recommendation, I booked M Social. I am so glad I did. If you look at the map of NYC and the top visitor attractions, it can look like things are  very far away from each other  but they really aren't . This hotel is a couple blocks from Time Square, theaters, Central Park, Rockefeller, most things are walkable . Keep in mind you will walk miles a day! The only visitor type things that we needed a taxi for were the 9/11 Museum, 9/11 memorial , ferry to Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island, SOHO and Hudson yards. So, a lot of words to say this is a fantastic hotel located in a great spot ! I've already recommended this hotel to a friend ! I'll be back !

title: Great Hotel
text: Hotel was great and close to alot of stuff!! I recommend this hotel, the room was nice and clean, housekeeping was great, front desk service was great, bartenders at the bar was very friendly great customer service.

title: Big Apple
text: This hotel is excellent if you want to walk and tour New York. The hotel was awesome, clean, decorated nicely, and the staff was always willing to help. Our room had a beautiful view of the city towards Times Square. Highly recommend this hotel and we plan on coming back to stay here again.

title: Chic hotel was great find
text: When the weather turned stormy we had to find a room to overnight in NYC. We were fortunate to find availability at M Social Hotel near the Theater District in Manhattan. The hotel was lovely and the staff were great. Our room had a terrific view of Times Square, yet it was quiet and comfortable. We were very happy with our stay.

title: M Social après Novotel
text: This former Novotel hotel was bought by the "Millennium Hotels & Resorts" hotel chain. Since 2012, we have always been going to the Novotel as a family and we have noticed that the new owners have saved money by not changing the bedding on the lower floors, namely the most accessible for less well-off families. The decorations of the rooms are the same. And the staff makes no effort to speak French when you don't understand something. In short, we need to find a new hotel for the next family trip to NY or else know what we expect and pay as little as possible. But for the price, there are so many other hotels that you have to see and try to discover something else.

title: Colado na times square
text: O hotel fica numa zona bem badalada de NY. Pra quem busca esse tipo de viagem deve ficar aqui. O hotel é bem descolado, tem famílias, casais e gente a trabalho. Café da manhã atendeu as expectativas, já que comer em NY é bastante caro.

title: Great Location, Great Hotel
text: I specifically wanted to be close to all the “big” musical theatres in NYC, so M Social was perfect.  Great room, friendly staff, can highly recommend.  I had a high floor, “view” room - again, really worth it.

title: Chambre double spacieuse mais lits doubles bien trop petits pour des adultes ou des ados.
text:
Tout était très bien sauf la literie.
Lits doubles ne mesurent  pas 1m40. Ce problème devrait être résolu. 
Le staff a essayé de nous faire plaisir en nous procurant une machine à café et une bouilloire électrique. 
Staff agréable. Femmes de ménage adorables.

title: Would stay again… and again….. and again!!!
text:
My partner and I stayed in this hotel 13th Feb – 18th Feb 2023. Between we honestly do not have a bad word to say about it. For what we paid, we were over the moon. We reserved a Times Square room and the views were incredible. We were on the 31st floor and personally I feel like we had the best room in the hotel (1305).
From check-in to check-out, every encounter we had with a member of staff was 10/10. Every question or query we had was answered with such kindness and politeness.
We only had breakfast in the hotel once and although expensive, it was very good with a very good selection on offer.
The feel and décor of the hotel was great. A very relaxed, modern feel which was perfect after long days wondering around the city.
The room was cleaned/serviced every single day to a very high standard. We even had a pizza delivery one evening which the porters were more than happy to assist with.
Before going there were a few reviews we read about the inconvenience of the hotel having two lifts, one from street level to the lobby, and then another from the lobby to the rooms. This was the case, however no way near as much of an inconvenience as some reviews suggest.
Upon check-out there was a very streamlined process in place when it came to leaving your luggage if you had a later flight. All free of charge and they even ask if you want a taxi reserved for when you collect your luggage to take you to the airport. I would recommend this as they flag a yellow taxi which has a fixed price of $70 from Manhattan-JFK. Pre-booked vehicles were in excess of $100.
I would highly recommend this hotel. The locations is perfect, less than a minute walk in to Times Square as well as literally on top of the subway. 10/10 from me!

title: Great stay with 22 teens
text: I brought 22 teens to NY from Georgia and M Social was great throughout the whole ordeal. Lorenzo was awesome! I will stay again in the future as long as they continue to have the kind of staff they have now.

title: Just okay
text: The check-in line was slow and frustrating - the desk was understaffed. The room was smaller than other nearby hotels with similar prices, but we had a very good view of Times Square. The bed was great, and the shower too. One of the bedside lamps was broken, and the sofa was stained which was gross and didn't seem like housekeeping had attempted to clean the stains off... yuck. The lobby bar was fun and the outside bar deck is great - but the drinks are very overpriced. Also - didn't appreciate the attitudes of two of the bartender staff, slow and somewhat discourteous.

title: Brilliant - Can’t wait to go back
text:
Brilliant, after a nightmare couple nights at a hotel across the road we spent last part of the trip at the M Social, Times Square. 

Reserved the room via the website while walking to the hotel and by the time we were in the lobby the room was ready (way before the set check in time) staff were helpful, had a minor issue with the room which was very quickly dealt with while we were out. They have a great bar (Prob the quietest roof/terrace in NYC). Considering the hotels location the room was nice and quiet. 

Will go back in an Instance, hopefully we can make it back soon - Thank you for rescuing our trip from ‘The Nightmare Hotel, Times Square’ across the road.

title: My new "go to" hotel in the city
text: This was my first time staying at MSocial.  The location is great, the room size is good for NYC rooms, cleanliness and staff were all great.  The rooms are very quiet and free from exterior and interior noise.  Highly recommend it if you are looking for a hotel room.  It is no frills but great value for the product.

title: Perfect location and awesome views!
text:
This was our first trip to New York so I searched for hotels that were central and we hit the jackpot with this hotel! 

When we first arrived we went upstairs for check in and I think it’s the fastest we’ve ever checked in to a hotel. They took my credit card for the hotel tax which we were aware of as this is common in New York and gave us our hotel room and that was pretty much it. I had seen on some reviews for other hotels that money had been removed from their cards and not been put back on for security deposits etc but I never had any trouble and the payment I was told came off after we got home. 

On the first night we went for a quick walk and we found ourselves on Time Square in a couple of minutes and we were a 5-10 min walk from the big attractions like Rockefeller, Empire State etc. 

Our room was lovely and clean and much bigger than I expected for New York. We had a couple of issues including not having a lot of storage even though the room was huge. We like to unpack but really struggled to find space to put away our clothes. Getting ready was sometimes a struggle as there was only small lights so the rooms were very dark. The room was very cold and we couldn’t work out the heating so having a shower was awful because it was freezing when getting out. The shower also leaked really bad onto the tiles throughout the bathroom which made it slippy and dangerous and we booked this room last minute and it turned out to be a disabled room so it’s lucky me and my mum are both steady on our feet. We were hardly in our room so non of these issues it were a major and we were just happy that the bed was comfortable and the room was clean. 

The lobby was beautiful and chilled if you wanted to relax after a full on day. We didn’t make it out onto the rooftop bar but the views were amazing and we did go for tea in the restaurant one night and were given a table with the best view to Times Square. I would recommend the restaurant if your knackered one day and don’t want to go back out walking. My only complaint with the restaurant was the large amount of tip they put on the bill that we had to pay and being from the UK we weren’t sure what the rules were and we were chased out of the restaurant saying we hadn’t paid enough which was quite embarrassing. I did apologise and pay up but like I said we thought the tips were optional and had already paid quite a large tip so just be careful and check the bill before leaving. The hotel is also next door to Gallaghers steak house which is amazing and I would definitely recommend if your happy to pay a little bit more. 

Overall this hotel was perfect for what we wanted and my mum was so obsessed with the views of Times Square from our hotel room that she said she needs to go back. We will definitely be coming back to New York and if it’s in our price range we will definitely be coming back to this hotel.

title: Très chouette hôtel sur Times Square
text:
Nous y avons séjourné 2 nuits suite à l’annulation de notre vol retour.
Très bon rapport qualité prix, personnel très aimable .
Les petits déjeuners et dîners sont top.
Belle vue sur Time Square avec un joli Rooftop.
Seul bémol : souvent de l’attente aux ascenseurs .

title: Great location
text:
M Social is a great hotel for exploring the city. Times SQ, Rockefeller, central pk, Moma, all only a few minutes on foot.
Suitable for families and business trips. The bar and the terrace over looking Times Square is a major plus. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Séjour fantastique
text: 3e séjour dans cet hôtel et nous aurions du mal à aller ailleurs. Personnel disponible, accueillant, souriant et serviable. Chambres propres et bien équipées. Une terrasse et un bar avec vue imprenable sur Times Square. Le Top !!!

title: anniversary
text: staff was friendly and nice. the view was fabulous. the bar and rooftop view was perfect for our special occasion. the prices for the hotel and drinks wasn't bad. the restaurant should stay open until 12am

title: Fantastic property with added bonus
text: Loved this hotel. Fantastic location just above Times Square, close enough to work to but far enough away so you aren't in the centre of the mayhem. Also only a 10 minute walk to Central Park and the shops of Fifth avenue. Our room on the 31st floor was comfortable and in great condition and also had an amazing view of Times Square. The rooftop bar was an added bonus as we didn't expect to be able to use it in February but the weather was kind. Definitely a hotel we will stay at again when we return to New York.

title: Super Cool Hotel, Amazing Location!
text:
We loved everything about our stay at  MSocial! Highly recommended & we will definitely stay here next time we’re visiting NYC.
Amazing location, super comfy beds, unbeatable lounge/foyer area with great views over Times Square!

title: Ticks all the boxes - Super location
text: We stayed as a family of 4 for a 5 day holiday.  Location is brilliant with a lovely view of Times Square, especially nice at breakfast.  Staff are very good.  Rooms are nice (don't expect lavish space in this prime location). Fitness Centre is good too.  Highly Recommend for a family trip to see all the sights

title: City break in New York
text: The hotel was quite centrally placed and not unpleasant. The reception area is on a completely different level to the entrance, accessible by a separate lift. This was a bit of a pain at busy times, especially when one of the lifts broke. The room was ok, but no tea/coffee making facilities and the remote control for the tv would only move the channel up not down. The resort fee is quite high at $40 per day, which I’m not sure exactly what it’s for, but a bit of a rip off all the same. They try and offset it with $10 bar credit, but this will probably get you half a lager. We were hardly in the hotel which made it bearable, but definitely wouldn’t stay there again.

title: Great place!
text: It's a little pricey but I'd stay here again. Terrific stay - ideal location. The staff is great too. The lounge is spacious with lots of different gathering spots for small or large groups. It's just ideal. Thanks!

title: Great location
text: The hotel is in a great location.  Very close to time square but not in the center of the crowds.  The room was very small but that is normal size in NYC.  The furniture was very scratched and the bed mattress needed replacement.

title: Fabulous location, beautiful hotel
text: We truly loved our stay at this hotel. We brought our ten year old son for his birthday and the hotel exceeded our expectations! The staff was extremely kind to all of us. The location was very convenient to Times Square/Broadway. We will be back!

title: Great Stay in NYC
text: Staff and facilities were very comfortable.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Having the restaurant / bar there was nice.  It was always very clean throughout the entire hotel.  Great location close enough to Timesquare to enjoy but not so close that we heard the noise when we wanted to rest.  Rooms were a bit small but comfortable.

title: Great location, nice rooms and staff. Fully recommended!
text: Definitely recommend the hotel for its location close to all metro lines, very quiet rooms and large, very friendly staff. Amazing views over Times Sq from the roof terrace at the bar! Rooms have all amenities needed and were very clean!

title: Excellent hotel
text: The hotel was in perfect location and great restaurant. I would have liked a better view from room but it was still great. The check in and out process was easy. The staff was so friendly and welcoming.

title: great get away in the big apple
text: This was my second stay M Social. Its so conveniently located and well staffed. The price was very reasonable and our room was comfortable.  I do wish there was coffee in the room but we easily found coffee near the hotel.

title: Great Hotel in an Excellent Location
text: We had a great stay at the M Social.  In the past, we have enjoyed staying at Novotel, but it has become an M Social Hotel. We had a wonderful stay.  Alvin at the front desk could not have been more welcoming. We stay in New York for 3 days in January or February each year.  Alvin treated us as though we there every month.  All employees were friendly and kind.  The housekeeping staff were very attentive and pleasant. Breakfast was delicious.  We had a drink after the show, and the view is great.  Times Square is lit up before your eyes.  There is also an outdoor seating area with great views.  Unfortunately the wether was too cold for me , but many people went out for a photo or to enjoy the view. M Social is in a great location for walking to theater or even to Central Park. It is also priced very well. We will continue to stay here.

title: M Social Hotel
text:
Location is one of the strengths, the view from the lobby to Times Square is one of the best and you can enjoyed your free time in the lobby with family and friends.
Our room was great we had view to Times Square and it was very comfortable.
There are a few things that we didn't like, for example to go to the lobby you need to take the elevator with all your luggage and it could be tedious.
The staff in the morning were a little bit cold and rude, nevertheless the staff in the afternoon were very kind.

title: Very good location, amazing view from room
text: This Hotel is very hip and central and very nice. We were walking distance to Time Square and restaurants, subway and if you are not lazy :) also to Central Park. The only small tip I would give about this hotel, check your bank statements, as we had fraudulent activity on my card during the middle of the night and the hotel staff did not give us an explanation.

title: Good location, but check reviews and read-between-the-lines before booking!
text:
An 'ok' hotel and I was flying blind trying to book something from afar. This one looked good online, but was a bit disappointed upon arrival. A bit of a dingy entrance where you have to take an elevator to get to hotel lobby, which isn't bad but elevators are slow and were down a handful of times during my stay. So if you just want to run downstairs quickly to grab some McDonalds, it just adds one extra step. I didn't find anyone overly friendly staff-wise. One server at the Restaurant was even quite rude and kept rushing me. They also didn't have any clean tables and the floor was a mess, and it's carpet! 

 I felt for the front desk staff, as many people will complain about this - the "Destination Fee" they charge daily (30$ approx?) is a joke. Total joke. You get one beverage for $10 (keeping in mind they've inflated drink prices, so a cocktail is $18 approx), and then one comp bike pass, comp long-distance calls (whoopie) and comp high-speed internet and gym access (what hotel DOESN'T have that anymore???) and 25% off hop on hop off tour, which is also a joke when there's a guy on every corner offering you a deal. Then I paid $8 for a coffee. 8$ plus tip for $10. And you still have to charge it and let them know upon check-out that you had a non-alcoholic beverage or they won't take off the $10! Food is way overpriced for the taste. The windows are somewhat soundproof but the adjacent doors between the rooms are not, so beware of that. And regular hotel elevators are a bit quirky. 
On a good note though, the rooms were decent, and a Times Square view on the 30th floor is awesome and worth it. Beds were amazing, super comfy beds and sheets and pillows. Shower is cool too. And you cannot beat the location if you want it all - theatre district, restaurants, shopping, Times Square, etc. Blackout curtains are awesome, I slept in every day! 
I think if I ran this hotel, I'd up the perks for the Destination Fee, (or just get rid of it!) and definitely make free coffee, FREE, or at least in room.

title: Great views with the right room
text:
The location is fantastic, just a few blocks away from Times Square.

The elevator system is poor. There are two at ground level, you need to take on to get to level L and check in. Then every time you arrive or leave the hotel you need to do the same, so two elevators to get to and from your room. As you can imagine, it's a pain and can cause delays and queuing. 

The walls are thin. One night the people next door were having party, somebody else called security which sorted it. You can pretty much hear conversations the walls are so thin. One night the couple next door were having a 'good time', that would have been awkward with kids in the room!

The room was clean and dark and the bathroom was nice. AC worked well. The view was amazing, I was on level 32 (3203).

title: The BEST hotel near Times Square
text: I stayed here Jan 19-Jan23 from Atlanta and Flora greeted me with a huge smile, was very welcoming and just made my stay there PERFECT. I order room service some of the days I were there and staff was friendly and fast. I really enjoyed the extra layers of security as far as the elevators were concerned. If ever in Times Square, M SOCIAL hotel is where you should stay! 10 stars

title: You will not be safe. Your room will be raided while you're away by the staff!!
text: I would never stay here again!! The maids kept asking to clean our room even though the DND (Do Not Disturb) was on the door. The hotel halls and ice machine were disgustingly dirty. She had plenty to do, but she would do nothing but knock on DNDs. This hotel made me lose all faith in privacy, safety, and peace of mind! The hotel bell staff/ security would watch my wife and I leave and would take that time to raid our room. We noticed items moved but thought it was just in our heads. After jewelry came up missing on the 6th or 7th day of our stay, I called for the security to come up. After 45 minutes, no one showed up. So, I called to request security and the police this time. At this point security came up and told me that they were the ones who had gone in my room and that it was a fire alarm went off after we left (only in our room!) No one had told us anything when we came back , there was no note on the door, nor any messages left on our phones. Nothing was said until we called down to complain!! OMG! SMH! When I asked for the police, can you believe they werecalled, but not for me?! They were called on me!!! And because of some NYC law (per the officers on scene) the hotel was able to have us removed 2 days before NYE (with a refund for the remainder of our stay)  because the security that was supposed to be securing us was stealing from us!! WOW!! We had been there for about 6 or 7 days of a 12 night stay. But because we realized the security had been stealing from us, we were removed by the police but given a refund for the remainder of our stay! I had to type that again because it is UNBELEIVABLE!!! And to this day, I have been "partially" reimbursed for the remainder of my stay. They lied and said its for a smoking fee, but we don't smoke and it was never mentioned until I got the partial refund a month later. I have not been reimbursed for my stolen items nor have the criminals/ security been disciplined let alone charged!! I lost all faith in hotel privacy and safety after this! I will never be the same!

title: Management and staff are dishonest
text:
The hotel definitely has potential and in a good location but the hotel staff failed to inform us the city would be shutting off the water to the building in the morning for SEVERAL hours. They said we should have received a letter to our room but we didn't. We also checked in at 6pm the evening prior so the reception desk staff would have had the opportunity to let us know but didn't, and they were already fully aware based on my conversations in the morning with management. 

This was irresponsible and a huge inconvenience as I had early business meetings I couldn't prepare for and I wasn't able to shower, wash my face, brush my teeth before a long international flight. No refund can make up for how this affected an important and busy day. Had I known, I wouldn't have checked into the hotel or would have at least been able to prepare to shower at a gym and take my meetings elsewhere but that just wasn't the case. I was also told around 7am the water would be back on by 8am, but when I left the hotel around 9:40am, it still wasn't on. The hotel staff and management are dishonest and this was truly a dissapointing experience.

title: Loved the M Social
text: Amazing, clean hotel. Central location for 3 subway stops, friendly staff and loved the  rooftop bar with view over Times Square. We had a high up bedroom with two double beds and river views which was very quiet. Hotel was in ideal location for walking too, we did 14km our first day and saw lots of the sights including central Park. Definitely recommend

title: Fabulous location central to everything. Great staff!
text:
I cannot say enough about the warm, greeting at the door and on the seventh floor for registration and my multiple encounters with the staff. It is amazing to have such hospitality in an area that is so busy and known for its hustle and bustle of tourism and not much more in time square! Bravo, JC and Ariana and the door staff upfront as well!

The beds are extremely comfortable. The towels are oversized, and although the rooms are a bit smallish, everything else makes up for any shortcomings. I will be back!

title: A great experience:))
text:
The staff is very friendly and kind. The hotel rooms are clean and if your on the higher floor you have an amazing view!! 
It is just 2min away from times square which is great. I recommend this hotel a hundred percent :)
Hotel also has breakfast which is also great if you’re new in the city and don’t know where to eat ;)

title: Worth it!
text: My daughter and I recently stayed at this hotel for a long weekend and it was fantastic!  The location is great.  It's near lots of attractions (Times Square, Broadway, Rockefeller Center) and restaurants while at the same time it doesn't feel like it's in the middle of everything.  The staff was friendly and helpful and the room was clean and comfortable.  I would highly recommend this hotel and plan to go back!

title: Amazing
text: Good Location, Clean Rooms ,Warm place to stay helpfule and very kind staff Great security team thank you all Special thanks for Ms.Flora smiling all the time . They give good room as i request the lobby is very nice to spen your night with friends

title: Wonderful place for tourism
text: This hotel is well situated for tourists, being close to many places to visit (Times Square, Central Park, museums, Metopera, Broadway,Harlem..). The rooms are quiet, while very close to Broadway, with a restaurant with a scenic view on Times Square..

title: Short vacation trip
text: First time at this hotel and I was very pleased.  My room had the view of Times Square and it was absolutely gorgeous at night. We were also within walking distance to the Broadway shows, Rockefeller Center, Radio City, lots of restaurants.  I would recommend this hotel.

title: Super bad staff
text:
The worst hotel I have ever been to. I am traumatized by the experience I had here. The staff and manager are racists, non cooperative and very rude. 
1) After a super hassle checkin process(which was actually their issue but they kept blaming my credit card), i went to their bar. The South American waiter their misbehaved with me. first he very rudely asked "what?" while i was waiting for my turn. To which when i said i want water, he said "cant you see I am working". Then i stood silently there waiting for him to get free. To that in 2-3 minutes, he shouted infront of everyone "What? I am busy". I said "OK then tell me when can i come back". He said "15 mins". 
When we raised this behavior to the manager, he sent away the waiter on a break so that we cannot pinpoint him. No apologies whatsover from anyone.
For the next few days also, nobody followed up with us, rather we only had to keep following up with the hotel staff
After multiple follow ups, the hotel cooked up false stories and shifted all the blame onto us. 
We asked them to verify their claims with CCTV footage but they never did that. they did refunded approx 3% of the total room fare but all we wanted was an apology from that waiter.

title: My stay with M Social
text: As usual my stay with M Social was exceptional. Everything about M Social has been a delightful experience and I can’t wait to return! The location is perfect walking distance to most restaurants and theaters, museums and shopping.

title: BUYER BEWARE DOUBLE CHARGES !
text:
BUYER BEWARE ! 
We pre-paid for our stay at this hotel. When we checked out we were charged again ! The cost of the stay was in excess of $2600.00 and they charged us that amount twice ! When we notified them they initiated a “refund” but it was just a pacifying exercise. The refund NEVER came through and they ignore phone calls. You only get to leave messages in a non monitored voicemail. 

BE VERY CAREFUL OF THIS HOTEL ! Very careful !!

title: Hotel checks so many boxes
text: One of the coolest Bars and lobbys in New York. Comfortable clean rooms. Walgreens in the basement is very convenient.  It is hard however to shake off the cold and unfriendly check-in  staff. The bartenders were extra friendly.  Also breakfast is to expensive.

title: a hotel more than recommended!
text:
This hotel is really nice for different reasons. First of all, it is very well located in Manhattan, which allows you to go back to your room between two visits and to have as many attractions as possible nearby.
Then, the view is breathtaking on Times Square on one side and on the Hudson River on the other, quieter. The rooms are spacious and very clean, the cleaning staff does their job admirably.
And finally (and above all!), you are very well received. Indeed, after many adventures during my trip, I had the pleasure of meeting Flora, who, in addition to speaking French, gives very good advice, as do all the staff at the reception who are really very kind. I would also like to mention the invaluable help of the electricity manager, who was very efficient.
In summary, a hotel more than recommended!

title: Good morning, I really liked the hotel, it is very clean and very well maintained.  staff are very friendly.  The only p
text: Good morning, I really liked the hotel, it is very clean and very well maintained.  staff are very friendly.  The only part I didn't understand is that they charged me for breakfast but it was already included in the reservation.  I would like what the hotel can tell me about this.

title: FAB HOTEL FAB STAFF HIGHTLY RECOMEND - LOCATION COULDNT HAVE BEEN BETTER
text: I have  to say what a place to stay its right in the middle of times square - fab location and fab hotel - staff were amazing - and food was really nice - loved the fact the rooftop bar was just over looking TS it was an experience  -  the First floor bar and restaurant had a great buzz - great for families and kids - fuzz ball machine and lots of space and comfy lounge chairs - sofas to chill after a sight seeing day - couldnt recommend it enough - the manager Kristen was so friendly and just brilliant 5 STARS  - I was with my 2 x kids 28 and 14 years of age they loved it - The beds so comfy and spotless white cotton sheets my favourite

title: Location and Staff are Amazing!
text: This hotel has everything!  Location, friendly staff, bar/restaurant that has great food and clean rooms.  The views from the rooms and the main lobby area are beautiful, which made the atmosphere/vibe in the hotel very relaxing and nice.

title: Great experience, great location
text: This was a surprise to make my 9 year-old daughter’s dream come true. Location, experience: everything is perfect. Nothing to say except good things. Flora from the staff is a great asset and you should definitely try your best to keep her by your side. We will come back for sure. Thank you.

title: Excellent location and friendly staff
text: Everything was good: location is excellent and the room was clean through the whole stay. I didn't give a fifth star because there was no coffee machine in the room with free coffee pods and tea bags as it's customary in 4 and 5 star hotels. Also, I would've prefered if the hotel has its own parking lot

title: Hôtel moderne et très bien situé
text: Bien situé, près de tout à pieds, métro tout près, chambre spacieuse, terrasse intéressante, personnel sympathique très bien pour les familles, chambre silencieuse. Nous avons eu une river view room au 32 ieme étage, vue spectaculaire.

title: Dirtiest Hotel in NYC
text: There were dead flower petals all over the room when we arrived. No joke. On the bed, on the bathroom floor, all over the carpets, under the couch pillows and cushions, and in the magazine rack. Ew. Spoke to some sort of supervisor - Kristen - and showed her the pictures of everything and she only offered me $80 off! I Went to battle for myself and finally had to settle for and additional $150. Just... the worst service and the grossest hotel I've ever been in.

title: Ok. Not great. Location is selling point
text: We stayed in 2 rooms for 3 nights. Rooms are small (but it was s NYC so that’s expected) what we didn’t expect was how worn the rooms were, how cheaply attired and the hall way carpeting was crumpled.
