title: Grata experiencia
text: El hotel tiene una ubicación excelente a pocos pasos de TIME SQUARE, las habitaciones son muy espaciosas, la limpieza un 10, nada de ruidos. Muy recomendable el restaurante del hotel, las vistas son espectaculares y la comida, pediros la hamburguesas están ricas y la carne está también muy buena, los precios son como si comerias fuera y la calidad mucho mejor hicimos 2 cenas allí. El personal muy agradable y servicial siempre intentando en ayudar en todo.

title: Wonderful!! Would highly recommend.
text:
In June we visited New York for a couple of days. This hotel was everything we hoped for: an excellent hotel right at the heart of New York. 
Having drinks and breakfast at the restaurant / bar was the highlight of the day. The location could not have been better. The kids had things to do in the Lobby so we all could relax. The family rooms are great (two rooms next to each other with a door in between), the view is magnificent and the staff is very friendly and helpful. 

We would certainly come back here!

title: Horrible for Business
text:
The hotel/staff are not equipped for the most basic of business travel needs. Splitting a bill, and putting multiple names on a reservation, took days of effort and nearly an hour at checkout. Despite repeatedly being told "it would be no problem."

The room had a leak which manifested as a large wet spot next to the bed. Maintenance took a long time to arrive, only to declare they could do nothing about it. We were not offered a new room until I went to the front desk to ask about it.

Housekeeping repeatedly failed to replenish shampoo and kleenex.

title: Great location!
text: Stayed here with my daughter for her 17th birthday. We loved the location just outside of Times Square and close to Central Park, many subway stations and plenty of great food options.  The lobby is cool and fun and the rooftop area stunning.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: Great location close to the park
text: Great location for a first-time NYC visitor. We liked that it was just outside of the madness of Times Square (and therefore quieter) and only a few blocks away from Central Park (my favorite part of NYC). Convenience was great, with a couple of subway stations nearby a large pharmacy/convenience store on the same block which made it easy to get drinks, snacks, toiletries, etc.

title: Great location and view!
text: The location is great, the price was reasonable and the rooms were adequate.  John, the concierge, was very pleasant and helpful taking care of our requests.  But there was a combination of things that make me say I wouldn't stay there again.  The elevator situation was extremely frustrating. There never seemed to be more than half the elevators working so waiting in line was not unusual.  All the ice machines in the hotel were not working.  You could order a bucket of ice and might get it.  The recommended way was to go to the bar and get ice.  The bartenders were happy to give you a plastic cup of ice.  If you wanted more than that it was like you were trying to rip them off.  The rooms are very dimly lit, even the bathroom.     Only half of the outlets in the room worked.

title: Great Times Square Location
text: I was pleasantly surprised at how nice this hotel was  for the price  I got it. The location was amazing and we had the best view out our window of Times Square that looked straight onto the New Years ball. The rooms were very small but they were clean and nice.

title: Excellent location, room and roof terrace
text: This hotel is located on the north end of Times Square and affords amazing views of Times Square from the brilliant roof terrace which wraps round 3 sides of the hotel. The room also had a jaw dropping Times Square view! The lobby, bar and restaurant were very impressive, but unfortunately were occasionally unavailable due to functions. There is a $40 a night destination fee, and it was a shame that the benefits of this were not communicated at time of booking so that we could incorporate them into our trip. One nice addition, especially due to the destination fee, would have been coffee and refill bottled water facilities for guests..... as we had available to us in our Boston hotel..... so maybe something for the management to think about? However, we had an amazing time in NYC and at the M Social.

title: Great Hotel & Great Location
text:
Really lovely hotel. 
Great location - so close to Times Square. 
Clean rooms, great views of the city. 

On arrival the reception staff were very friendly. 

We stayed on the 30th floor and we had some great views of some of the buildings :) 

The bar was really nice to sit and chill around, you get given a $10 a day allowance towards the bar which I thought was good. 

I would definitely recommend this hotel and if I returned would stay here again.

title: Expensive, Hotel bar / restaurant closed for private party
text:
The room had the best view of time square. The rooms were clean and very nice staff. 

However, at almost $900 per night, it was ridiculous that half the rooftop bar and entire inside bar / restaurant was closed to the customers due to a private party (inside bar) and photo shoot (rooftop). 

Had we known we would be unable to utilize these features, we would have booked somewhere else. 

Also, the elevators are extremely slow.

title: Very nice and comfortable in a great location!
text:
very nice, comfortable, not-small rooms, with all required amenities to enjoy your vacation. Great location near Times Square, walking distance to few subway stations making it easy to explore the city. 
Helpful staff.
Only reason not giving 5 stars is a basic breakfast which is not cheap.
Overall, definitely worth it and our family loves this hotel.

title: Great location but don't bank on being able to sit on the Times Square view balcony at all times
text: Great location, comfortable bed, clean room, clean hotel. The only criticism I would have is that quite often (I stayed 5 nights and I noticed it twice) they allow private functions to book out the bar area including the Times Square view balcony. Given that's the only reason I booked this hotel it was very annoying. Especially when you are guests and they have bouncers stopping you entering the bar area. We were also told that we could use an alternative bar but when we tried to order at 10.45pm we were told they were closed. My advice to the hotel is to put their guests first and not to allow areas to be fully booked out.

title: Staff incompetent and unhelpful
text: First, the reception is next to the very noisy lobby/bar with loud music playing (which could be heard several floors up). Hard to understand person checking you in. Most of the outlets and several of the lights (including the primary light) in our room didn’t work and it took two maintenance staff pulling furniture away from the walls to find the problem. Clearly housekeeping didn’t check. No amenities in the bathroom, like disposable shower caps, etc. Shower door didn’t close so impossible to keep the floor from getting wet. We needed urgent care medical assistance and the front desk was no help — told us to call 911 when we’d already said it wasn’t an emergency. Unpleasant response when we asked for a late check out since one of us had been up all night. Altogether, a lousy experience.

title: Worth It
text:
We have visited NYC quite a bit.  I usually don't leave reviews, but wanted to acknowledge that this was one of the best hotels that I have stayed.  I was worried to stay in the Times Square area because it can be seedy and too crowded, but this was a couple of blocks from all the excitement.  Here is why i recommend this hotel: location to subway stations and theater district,  rooms are large for NYC, lobby is large for NYC, outside terrace is EXCELLENT with a view of Times Square, and full service hotel with restaurant, bar, concierge, and daily cleaning.  

Room with a Hudson River view- a beautiful change from the hustle/bustle of Times Square. 23 floor and street noise was minimal.  View of the Theater District marquees and saw a huge cruise ship sail along the Hudson.

title: Amazing
text: I’m in the city once a month or so. Always stay at m social. Perfect location amazing bar and rooftop with views of the city.  Young lady at front desk from Hungary is wonderful ( can’t remember her name). Looking forward to my next stay in July..

title: Great time! Will be back again for sure!
text: M Social was excellent! The hotel was very modern, and settled within walking distance of every show we saw! Also loved the security feature to use the elevators. Everything felt very safe. Staff was very friendly and helpful, and the room was nice as well.

title: Bien, mais…
text: L hôtel est bien placé tout près de Time Square, l établissement est propre et dispose de nombreux services. Quelques bémols tout de même : un tuyau de douche tout percé quasiment inutilisable, pas de gel douche à notre arrivée et nous avons dû en quémander tous les jours à l accueil qui nous donnait 2 échantillons pour 3 personnes à chaque fois, j ai fini par laisser un mot à la dame de ménage pour en obtenir !!! Le lit pour 2 personnes faisait à peine 140cm de large, la Clim est beaucoup trop fraîche et impossible à régler (nous devions l éteindre le soir). Nous n avions pas opté pour les petits déjeuners car on avait vu des avis disant qu il fallait faire la queue à l ascenseur pour ensuite remonter dans les chambres ce qui finalement n était pas le cas, nous avons donc essayé de modifier cela sur place mais ils nous auraient été facturés 27€/jour/personne ce qui nous a semblé excessif malgré un buffet très achalandé. On a donc choisi de prendre les petits déjeuners juste en face du lobby de l hôtel (chez Angelina) c est au top !

title: Exiting hotel was some times annoying.
text: Exiting and entering the hotel was annoying at times. On a couple occasions, we had to wait for two parties to go on the elevator before we could leave the hotel. Adding a staircase as an option could make exiting and entering the hotel so much easier and quicker.

title: Not Bad
text:
I brought a group here that saw 3 Broadways shows on the trip.

Location: great for Broadway-goers! They have a 7th floor lobby with plenty of space to gather. The outdoor area is nice with great views of Times Square. Rooms were clean and larger than a usual Manhattan hotel room. We had two issues during our stay...no hot water and the hotel disabling keys the morning we checked out (so those that went for breakfast were locked out of their rooms).

Adasha (the manager) was very helpful in compensating us for these issues. It's nice to see a manager who cares about their guests. I bring groups to NYC often and will continue to use this hotel if they continue to show interest in customer satisfaction. Adasha did a good job handling our group! One of the best hotel managers I've seen. Will be back.

title: Great Hotel near Broadway!
text: Clean hotel with a nice lobby bar with an incredible outdoor rooftop bar! We were fortunate enough to have an amazing view from our room! Staff couldn’t have been any friendlier! Manny served us drinks most nights and Carlos took care of our breakfast and coffee needs!

title: Close to the theater district and Times Square.
text:
I would definitely recommend this hotel to friend and will plan to stay again on my next trip.
the staff was very helpful.
I found it perfectly located near Times Square and the theater district.
The roof top bar and terrace have amazing views and are a wonderful place to enjoy the views.

title: Location and value for money
text: Great hotel,  excellent central location, rooms are a good size and well appointed. The staff are friendly and efficient. We didn’t realise that we got a $10 daily discount on bar drinks which was a bonus. Loved ending each evening enjoying a drink on the sky bar terrace - amazing views. Would definitely stay again if coming to New York.

title: M Social Times Square
text:
This is our second time staying at the M Social near Times Square.  The hotel is neat, clean and modern.  We really enjoyed the roof top area.  Such beautiful views of the city.  We also love the location of this hotel.  We are already planning a trip back and plan to stay at the M Social then as well. 
 e love Gallagers  located next door and you must try Angelina's bakery just across the street.

title: Times Square Gem.
text: First trip to the Big Apple. The hotel is very conveniently located to anything you would want to do in the upper Manhattan area. It is also close to the subway and bus routes. The room was larger than I expected and very clean. The beds were very comfortable as well.  There is an outdoor patio with the most wonderful view of Times Square. Will definitely stay here again next trip.

title: Happy vacation
text:
We booked two double rooms and we were located on the 32nd floor. The view of the Hudson was great and the room itself was a decent size and was really comfortable. 

This hotel was great. We checked in at about 4pm local time and it was quick. The hotel lobby is brilliant. It has a football table and nintendo switch and another game we're you slide these discs down a table. It was a great place to wait and chill in. 

The hotel roof terrace was very cool and a good size. It was a great place to relax on and enjoy the views. 

The staff were great and very helpful. 

The location of the hotel is perfect. Next to the metro and literally next to Times Square and so I would definitely recommend and stay at this hotel again.

Thanks for a great stay

title: Customer Service and follow through
text:
Adasha, Yahaira, and Shauna, all represented the M Social fabulously! I'd like to thank them all for helping make our gathering, for my son's graduation from NYU, a success. Ms. Pena also provided guidance on how to best make our event happen. Cheers!
All the best,
Ross

title: Great location would return
text:
Good things:
*Fab view of Times Square from room and outside bar 
* Great location 
* Bar had a fab atmosphere 
* Bar had a games console and football table for kids 
* Food quite nice in hotel
*King rooms are lovely - modern bathroom

Disappointing things:
* Double rooms are little under equipped (for a family of 4)
- Not much storage space
- Bathroom tiny

title: Such a delight!
text:
We stayed several nights last week here. What a wonderful time we had. Check-in was easy (Stella is a class act). Rooms are easy to find, and our room was comfortably spacious and clean. We were on the 31st floor, and had a great view of the Hudson River.

The lobby feels alive and vibrant; very much geared towards the younger crowd (which I tend to age further and further away from). The helpers at ground level were also friendly, and helped us call a cab when the time came to return to Penn Station.

We'd definitely stay here again!

title: Prima hotel in hartje Manhattan
text:
Op zich prima hotel. Mooi gelegen nabij Broadway en Times Square. Central Park op loopafstand. Aangename kamer met airco. Goed geïsoleerd; je hoort niets van buiten. De badkamer had wel wat schoner gekund. Beetje viezigheid en schimmel in de voegen. Ontbijt zeer beperkt.
Verbluffend mooi uitzicht vanaf het terras en restaurant.

title: Hotel was ok ……beware of Destination Fee
text:
Hotel room was ok, expected champagne and a coffee maker in the room as this was requested but wasn’t provided. Also thought we booked a room with a view of Times Square, this wasn’t entirely what we had. We stayed at the hotel for a special occasion so this was a little disappointing. Beware of the Destination Fee, we were not made aware of this before arriving and then your stung for $35 every night on top of what you have already paid. We won’t stay at this hotel again due to this charge. 
Bar area is good, staff were friendly and helpful. TV in the room wasn’t fitted properly and sat at an angle. 
Overall the hotel is good for a stopover, not quite what we expected as we were in NYC for our wedding and a 40th, and you must account for the undisclosed Destination Fee!!

title: Beautiful and Lively
text: Very nice and comfortable. The room was wonderful.  Just know that your room key will only allow you on your floor.  The bathrooms are dimly lit so putting on makeup and lashes are a hit and miss. There is no magnified make up mirror. If you want coffee in your room, you have to ask for the coffee maker.  But they brought it really quickly.  The hotel lobby near the bar was EPIC!! The music was on point.

title: Séjour mai 2022
text:
Séjour de 5 nuits, 
Accueil parfait avec réceptionniste parlant français, chambre en étage élevé ( comme demandé en commentaire de resa).
Chambre propre nettoyée tous les jours ( je précise car à priori certains s’en plaigne)
Pas pris de pdj.
Un bémol les horaires d’ouverture du bar et du restaurant qui ferment trop tôt pour un établissement dans cette zone de la ville.
Check out ultra rapide 
Donc très bien si ce n’est le prix pour nous pauvre français …. Mais ça nous le savions dès le départ

title: Nice stay Nice hôtel but average service
text: Confortable hôtel, good location Very good and efficient reception staff  but lack of service and insufficient room cleanliness un service  Simple catering with cuisine made with average qualité Blandin sauvages ……

title: Localização e conforto
text:
Super bem localizado, poucas quadras da Times Square, do Central Park  e próximo ao metrô. O hotel é muito bonito, moderno, lobby bem agradável, com bar e um terraço com uma vista maravilhosa da Times Square. 
Fomos super bem atendidos na recepção, tanto no checkin quanto checkout, as moças da limpeza do quarto bem atenciosas e simpáticas também. 
Ficamos no quarto com vista do Hudson, e é exatamente como nas fotos. Espaçoso, cama muito confortável, ducha forte e bem quente.
Tinha lido algumas avaliações comentando sobre valores altos cobrados no checkin, mas no nosso caso, o valor pago foi igual ao demonstrado pelo Expedia, sem surpresas. Eles fazem uma retenção de um valor para possíveis despesas, e depois devolvem na saída, mas todos os hotéis fazem isso.  
Enfim, adoramos tudo!!

title: 1st time in NY
text: Had a wonderful time in NY and loved staying at your hotel.  The location is perfect, the views from the inside dining and outside seating area were spectacular.  Rooms were very nice and clean and all staff were very nice and accommodating.  Thank you

title: Disappointing
text:
Nice hotel, great location, expensive but it is in Manhattan. 
Upon arrival, credit card details were taken as security deposit. However, credit card was charged (~$400) rather than amount held. Upon departure, we paid the agreed price which we had arranged at reservation. Despite several emails, and now a month later we have not been returned our security deposit. 
Very disappointing. Will not be recommending to friends or family travelling to NYC.  Currently in contact with attorney to obtain refund .

title: Emplacement idéal.
text: Nous avons séjourné 6 nuitées dans l'établissement. L'équipe de réception est vraiment très sympa et dévouée à sa clientèle. L'hôtel est magnifique avec une immense salle de détente avec de multiples services. La vue de la terrasse vers Time Square est incroyable. La chambre était de très bonne qualité et la litterie était très bien. Sincèrement nous n'avons pas trouvé de défaut si ce n'est peut être la qualité des plats proposés pas exceptionnelle.

title: great stay
text:
The hotel has it all. 
A view
great food and drinks  
Live music and a great DJ 
Great location and with wonderful surroundings 
Security was wonderful. 
The rain shower was amazing. 
This was a very fun relaxing place

title: Super location and great staff!
text: Stayed at the M Social for 3 nights.  Picked hotel based on location and reviews.  Walked to our play, and to excellent restaurants in the area.  Incredibly helpful and friendly staff on all occasions.  Any issue was immediately seen to.  One issue was very first world -- wine in the bar was expensive.  :)

title: For All Michael Jackson fans 😍 this is the hotel for you,M social hotel hospitality and service is unmatched,
text: We loved our stay at M social Hotel😍…their hospitality is unmatched with positive vibe around.They have big rooms size which is rare in Newyork to find….The rooftop area was our favourite for drinks with amazing view of Times Square. And if you are an MJ fan like us then this it the hotel for you. Michael Jackson broadway show is adjacent to M social…

title: El personal es increíble.
text:
La ubicación es buenísima, puedes llegar en metro desde el aeropuerto y te deja en la esquina de la calle, es muy seguro nosotros llegamos a la 1 am y todo súper bien, el desayuno es buffet muy completo y más aún viajando con niños tiene variedad, frutas, bebidas y el clásico desayuno americano. La habitación limpia todos los días y muy cómoda.
El personal muy pendiente y agradable.
Sin duda Evelina del piso 18 hizo nuestra estancia muy agradable, hizo sentir a mis hijas muy cómodas, nos trató con cariño! Fue increíble que estuviese pendiente de lo que nos pasaba, sin duda fue lo más bonito.

title: Birthday week was a success!!!
text:
M social was nothing short of amazing! Welcomed me with a bottle of champagne for my 25th birthday and upgraded my room!! 
Yvens took care of us when we dined at the restaurant and his energy made my night!! Nothing but hospitable the whole weekend 
Will be back!

title: Great Service
text:
Yvens our server was fantastic
Great service 
Great food
Very personable 
Atmosphere was hip and upbeat.
Drinks were very good
We will be back
Great view of Times Square
Just wish it was not raining
Can’t wait to come back down and play Foosball and shuffleboard

title: Weekend Trip with the Family!
text: We visited M Social hotel with our family for the weekend to see a show on Broadway. We could not say enough positive things about it! The hotel itself was amazing and in a perfect location to get to the theater. We spent the majority of our time at the hotel in the lobby at the bar and in the restaurant, our waiter Yvens was fantastic. He took such great care of us and made our experience here even better! We will definitely be coming back.

title: מלון מצוין במיקום מרכזי Excellent hotel in a central location
text:
I stayed 8 nights in this hotel and very satisfied!
Receptionists are very patient and attentive to any request,
Breakfast very varied, great waiters thanks to the wonderful Carlos and Alberto.
I was given a room on a high floor and a partial view of Time Square, the room was spacious and relatively modern and the bed was very comfortable, one thing I was missing was a kettle and tea / coffee, and to take care of more soap supplements.
Another thing that bothered me was the slow lifts that were always full of people in such a period of covid 19 health problem.

I highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to New York.

שהייתי 8 לילות במלון הזה ומרוצה מאוד !
פקידי קבלה סבלניים מאוד וקשובים לכל בקשה,
ארוחת בוקר מגוונת מאוד, מלצרים נהדרים תודה לקרלוס ואלברטו הנהדרים.
קיבלתי לפי בקשתי חדר בקומה גבוהה ונוף חלקי לטיים סקוור, החדר היה מרווח וחדיש יחסית והמיטה הייתה נוחה מאוד, דבר אחד שהיה חסר לי זה קומקום ותה\קפה, ולדאוג ליותר השלמת סבונים.
דבר נוסף שהפריע לי זה המעליות האיטיות שתמיד היו מלאות באנשים שבתקופה כזו של covid 19 בעייה בריאותית.

אני המליץ לכל מי שנוסע לניו יורק על המלון הזה.

title: Super emplacement
text:
L'emplacement est vraiment super. Nous avions des chambres aux étages supérieurs avec vue sur Times square, vraiment au top. Malgré cela, pas trop de bruit. L'entretien des chambres était fait tous les jours.Les personnes étaient à l’accueil étaient sympa (sauf le soir de l'arrivée, personne arrogante et désagréable à la limite de l'impolitesse). Le concierge nous a arrangé le transfert vers l’aéroport, service de bagagerie nickel aussi.
Un petit point négatif est l'attente au petit déjeuner 20/30 minutes tous les jours sauf à prendre le petit déj vers 10h; quantité, qualité et diversité par ailleurs au rendez-vous. 
Le gros point noir c'est le lobby: du bruit en permanence, des personnes y compris extérieures à l'hotel squattant les canapés avec des boissons achetées à l'extérieur. Impossible donc d'y boire un verre d'autant que les serveurs n’étaient pas du tout efficace. C'est vraiment dommage après avoir marché toute la journée de ne pas pouvoir se poser pour boire un verre et profiter de la vue.

title: Highly not recommend
text:
Comfy beds but way too small for two people. The room is ridiculously small for a family of four.
The cleaning service is very poor. The surfaces and floor never got cleaned; they only made the beds and changed the towels, if so. Prove of that is the empty bottle of coke from the previous guests we found the first time we got in and the dust and stains everywhere.
The room didn’t get clean one day, and they did nothing to solve the issue in the afternoon, even though they said they would talk to the cleaning service to get the bed made. We had to let them know the day after that; nothing was fixed. They ended up refunding the destination fee that day, which they said they would do on top of making the room...
We had to keep calling the room service every day to ask for one extra towel set because they kept leaving three, despite saying we are four people on the booking.
Some of the plugs stopped working, and the toilet fan made a terrible noise (they 'fixed' it by disconnecting it)
The only good thing about this hotel is the location.

---
Camas cómodas pero demasiado pequeñas para dos personas. La habitación es ridículamente pequeña para una familia de cuatro.
El servicio de limpieza es muy deficiente. Las superficies y el suelo jamás se limpiaron; solo hicieron las camas y cambiaron las toallas, si acaso. Prueba de ello es la botella de coca cola vacía que dejaron los huéspedes anteriores y que encontramos cuando entramos y el polvo y las manchas por todas partes.
Al llegar una tarde, la habitación no se limpió un día y no hicieron nada para solucionar el problema, aunque dijeron que hablarían con el servicio de limpieza para que hicieran la cama (al menos). Tuvimos que avisarles al día siguiente de que no se había arreglado nada por la noche. Terminaron reembolsando la tarifa de destino ese día, cosa que dijeron que harían igualmente además de hacer la habitación...
Tuvimos que llamar al servicio de habitaciones todos los días para pedir un juego de toallas extra porque seguían dejando tres, a pesar de etsar registrado que éramos cuatro personas en la reserva.
Algunos de los enchufes dejaron de funcionar repentinamente, y el ventilador del baño hacía un ruido terrible (que 'arreglaron' desconectándolo)
Lo único bueno de este hotel es la ubicación.

title: Spring vacation
text: Good experience and had a great time visiting all the tourist attractions in the city. I would definitely recommend this hotel for you to stay and enjoy your vacation. Good location and service. Definitely coming back.

title: Quel dommage !
text: Nous avions l’habitude d’aller dans cet hôtel qui était un Novotel avant d’être racheté et devenir M Social Times Square. Rien à voir au niveau service. Les chambres ne sont pas nettoyées tous les jours. Il faut faire son lit soi même.. incroyable ! Sans compter la mauvaise surprise sur la caution à l’arrivée. 100 $ par jour par chambre. Si vous avez une carte de débit c’est autant d’argent bloqué jusqu au départ. Après notre départ il y a des mouvements sur notre CB. Il a fallu de nombreux mails pour obtenir les remboursements. L’emplacement reste idéal mais quel dommage nous allons devoir trouver une autre adresse pour notre prochain séjour.

title: Wow. Loved this hotel.
text: 4th trip to New York from Scotland, and by far THE best hotel we have stayed in. We had a great Times Square view room, with massive comfy bed and very roomy, which is a bonus in NYC. Bar staff were so friendly and chatty, and all in all a great find in a fab location. We will be back. One drawback-had to ask for a safe for the room and a coffee maker-both came with no issues.

title: Excellent emplacement/ hôtel moyen
text:
Nous avons séjourné dans l’hôtel 8 nuits. 
L’emplacement est excellent! Je le conseil pour un premier voyage à New York. Cependant, la chambre n’a pas été lavée durant tous le séjour malgré mes demandes à la réception + la queue au petit déjeuner le matin…  déçue en vu du prix/nuit……

title: Funky and friendly
text:
Researched hotels a lot of hotels jn NYC as we wanted one accessible by the subway via Airlink from JFK terminals. 

This was one of a few that came up and instantly I selected book when I saw how funky the interior was. 

All staff from lobby to cleaners were really friendly, room was smart and modern and well cleaned. 

Another positive is they have free 24hr baggage storage for when you checkout, so if your flight isn’t until evening you can still explore on your last day without wheeling a suitcase around. 

Paid extra for the daily breakfast which was worth it. Lovely selection of fresh fruit, continental items, hot breakfast items, juices and pastries. 

There were no tea of coffee making facilities in the room but I think there might have been flasks in the restaurant where you could make a drink there and bring it to your room. 

There was one really long line for breakfast but we must have hit it at a busy time as other days we didn’t really need to queue. 

Would definitely return to M Social. It turns out that some staff members have been there 25 years, so they must be doing something right. Bar staff were happy to make cocktails off the menu too.

title: Really Great Plade to Stay!
text: Absolutely loved this hotel. Great location, check. Clean room, check! Comfy, comfy bed, for sure! Great view of Times Square, check. Had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The room was clean and housekeeping serviced it daily. Good breakfast each morning in the lobby and you really can't be the location for access to shows, great restaurants and all Broadway has to offer. Would def stay here again.

title: Great experience
text: Wonderful experience! Great view. Clean. Friendly staff. Rooms a little small but it is New York. Wish it was queen size beds for length. Minimal noise heard from others and street even having a view of Times Square!

title: Dirty, dated, and rough
text:
I stayed at this hotel a few years ago when it was the Novotel, and wasn't a fan. But when I had to come back to NYC for work and my usual hotel wasn't available, I thought I'd give this one a try. So much wrong. But first, the people who work here are lovely and helpful, and no issues there.

The lobby is fine, music is too loud to actually hear the soft-spoken staff. Elevator buttons only sometimes work, so you're just as likely to sail past your floor as stop on it. Rooms are big for NY standards, but the highlights stop there. The brown bathroom shows off all the grime and grossness that had obviously not been cleaned. The towels, toilet paper, and bedding all seem to be designed for exfoliating for as rough as they are. The duvet is so light I thought they'd forgotten to include one (I asked for another, and they brought me a dirty blanket). The lighting is awful -- like they have to pay a wattage tax. The bed is very firm and the pillows are an odd assortment. There is certainly nothing plush about this space. There's also no hand soap, which is odd (especially given these covid times), no room service (or no menu/anything indicating they have it), no information about other hotel amenities like a gym, few outlets, and --in my room -- holes in the wall where I guess the TV was previously? Would not recommend.

title: Not for me.
text: I will start with the positives which is this hotel was located convenient to my plans in Manhattan for the weekend (a particular restaurant, a Broadway show, close to subway entrance). The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. But overall my stay was unpleasant. They have one of the later check-in times at 4 o’clock. I did arrive early and I understand rooms may not be ready but then the bell attendant tried to refuse storing my bag because he was “full.“ I was in a Times Square view room which is on the south facing side of the building and the views are spectacular. But the room was not great. The lighting was really poor. There was no pen and paper. There was no coffee maker of any kind even though there is a clear space in the cabinet for one with an outlet. There was a small refrigerator which is a plus but I also like mini bar options. (Although I did see there was a small store in the lobby.) And finally when I came home from my plans on Saturday evening extremely loud electronic music was blasting in the lobby. It was assaulting and I was forced to listen to it for awhile as the wait for the elevator tended to also be long during this day.

title: Great hotel
text: Perfect hotel. Great location! 3 min from Time Square. Nice room. Did not hear any noice of the city. Airconditioning a bit loud, but at least there is airconditioning. Nice bar with great view. Would definitely recommend it.

title: Unsafe & Disrespectful - Badly Injured
text: Let me start by saying, I gave the hotel every chance to make this right and stayed very respectful and they didn’t care one bit. I was taking a shower, sat on the shower seat (part of why I booked the room for those with disabilities) and it broke right from the wall. The legs shot up, gouged into my back, my hand hit the metal pole trying to brace the fall and I twisted my knee. My back is killing me, arm is hurt and as soon as I arrive home Ive already made an appointment with my doctor. The staff came to help after I called, with bags of ice to aid with the pain and swelling and reported the incident. After speaking to the manager, she said she was sorry and took me to another room. The new room bathroom seat IS ALSO BROKEN. This time I checked the bolts and they were broken off, after I was already assured the new room was safe. Absolutely unbelievable. After doing research it’s clear to me they are out of compliance with ADA for the safety of these bathrooms. The manager I spoke with today did not care at all. When I asked how they are going to make this right and ensure this does not happen to others, she said they would cover my incidentals and my breakfast. It was almost laughable. I stood in front of her speechless, they clearly do not care about the health and safety of their customers. A free breakfast? Are you serious? Her body language said it all, she didn’t not give a single care in the world. This is not how you treat your customers. I am sitting in my hotel room still in pain, and will soon find out the extent of my injuries when I come back to Canada. I can’t believe how little compassion this manager had for my situation, I was so angry but I kept it all inside of me to keep respectful but I need to tell the world. Avoid this hotel at all costs, the management here does not care for your safety, just for your money.

title: Everything was as expected
text:
Our check in experience was super fast and our room was on the 29th floor with great view. 
Room service was quick and food was good.
The breakfast was okay, on one rainy day they ran out of bagels and bread roll, which caused havoc with my kids :D 
I guess more people decided to have breakfast due to weather. 
Our housekeeper Elli was amazing and we always had fresh towels and a sparkling bathroom. 
Jim downstairs was a blessing as he let my son back in when he locked himself out.
I think overall you get what you pay for and the hotel is as advertised. 
You can’t beat the location as there are so many places you can walk to. Also easy to get a taxi which seems to be fairly cheap in NY.
I can’t say I’m ecstatic about the amenities charge which does increase your bill significantly but it was stated on my booking. It may be a good idea to mention it during check in.
Check out was very quick and I would suggest that one way to prevent the bad reviews I have read would be to ask people how there stay was during the check out process and give an opportunity for guests to air their frustration. If I could change one thing I would put tea and coffee making facilities in the room as a standard.
Overall, we had a great stay, location is amazing and hotel is well managed.

title: Séjour à l hôtel M Social de Manhattan
text: Venu à l époque ou il était Novotel, plus rien à voir. L emplacement est certes top mais les prestations sont indignes d un hôtel de ce standing. Impossible d avoir un expresso à 14h30 pas plus qu un café. Sachez que si vous commandez une salade césar à 19 dollars celle-ci comportera de la salade, un soupçon de fromage rapé et des croutons; le poulet est en option pour 6 dollars de plus. Les tables extèrieures ne sont pas nettoyées. Les chambres sont biens et le petit déjeuner à 25 dollars est correct. Nous reviendrons à Manhattan mais surement pas dans cet établissement à peine digne d un Ibis le prix en plus.

title: 3 Star hotel
text:
Stayed there this weekend. The "rooftop bar" is really an outdoor deck on the second floor. If I'd known this, I would not have booked this hotel. 

Other disappointments include: having to call room service for a bar of soap (at least it came immediately), having to call room service for a coffee maker (this would be a basic offering in a true 4 star, no?), having to receive a dirty coffee maker (seriously??) and a bathroom that while not filthy was definitely not clean. There was nothing about the decor or room that was 4-star, so honestly I feel it's mis-represented as a 4 star establishment. 

There is a bar and lounge (with tired, stained furniture) in the lobby. It had a live DJ, was very social with a lot of different people (families with young kids, 20 somethings, boomers and everything in between), but it wasn't clear whether the people were hotel guests so it made one feel like you are just hanging out in a Dave & Busters on your way upstairs. 

The folks are the front desk were very friendly (as were all the staff) but obviously over worked. At check out, I told them about the soap and coffee and the guy took a day's resort fee off of my bill. However, I haven't had a chance to review the bill in detail yet. Based on some of the reviews here I suspect that I won't be happy with what I see. 

Overall I definitely wouldn't stay here again as I prefer 4-5 star hotels and expect a higher level of quality.

title: Great location but…
text:
To sum it up.

Pros ; 

Great location, super views from room and bar area. Approx $70 one way from JFK in a taxi.

Lounge relaxing and comfortable. Felt safe. 

Rooms comfy and clean with excellent shower. Cleaners helpful and working hard. 

The Fri night (D.J I think) bar staff and the door staff who sorted taxi all were super friendly. 

Didn't try food so can’t  comment.

Cons ; 

Ridiculous security deposit amount $400.

Resort fees are a joke even when you say you dont want the perks. be prepared to pay $40 a day regardless as they won’t waive this.

Check in staff could work on their smile and be more welcoming.

No coffee/ tea in room. They brought one up but this should be standard.

Tv was not in front of the bed which is weird.

Would I stay again ? Probably not, there are plenty other options. 3 stars. 

That said, to get value for money, nyc is pricey so you would need to probably spend at least £500 a night to get a top premium hotel. However I would have expected a bit more even at the £250 a night mark.

title: Wonderful Experience!!!
text:
This is a great hotel!! The beds are so comfortable. It is a great location and super convenient!! The staff are all wonderful. Valentina was especially friendly. She did a great job on our room and was super helpful. I look forward to going back on our return visits!! 

Christine

title: Modern, great spot
text: Centrally located - especially if you are planning to do broadway and tourist hotspots.  Hotel had a nice modern vibe and bar area.  Friendly and helpful staff, great for a short stay in NYC.  Would stay here again if I had business in the area.

title: I LOVE THIS HOTEL…A HIDDEN GEM!!
text: My stay at this hotel was amazing! I love the modern vibes, all of the staff was extremely nice and helpful and to top it off it’s around the corner from Times Square!!! Definitely a must stay! Can’t wait to visit again!

title: Great place to stay at the heart of Time Square Manhattan
text: This is a fabulous option for a hotel if you are looking at a place in central Manhattan which is accessible by walk or a short ride to most areas. This is a hotel that surprised us with its simplicity yet vibrancy. The social area ( restaurant and bar) is vibrant with the rooms on top - that are quiet. Great clean pristine rooms that meet your needs - nothing fanciful but contemporary. Highly recommend.

title: Excellent hotel
text: Nous avons séjourné une semaine au M Social, super accueil, très propre et idéalement bien placé, proche de tout donc très pratique. Nous y retournerons certainement et nous le conseillons aux autres voyageurs.

title: Amazing view, Yummy food and Wonderful Service!!!!
text:
We had an amazing time for dinner tonight!!! 
Yvens E. was our server and he went above and beyond to make sure we were happy with our meal and drinks. The view from the roof deck can’t be beat. Will definitely be back. ❤️🍸

title: Location, location, location
text: Perfect location if you want to stay near Times Square. The view from the lobby is amazing! Staff was very helpful and the rooms were nice. You really aren’t in your room much if you are going to NYC!

title: Solid location. Decent for families.
text: For first-timers to NYC this is a good option. Right in the heart of Times Square. There are two elevators required to get to room levels, which for some might be annoying (and surprising). While we were there the hotel experienced an elevator outage which made things tricky. The staff were kind. Rooms are what you'd expect for this level of hotel - clean (not enough towels for four people in our room, one stained pillow). We had a small fridge in our room that we took advantage of for quick breakfasts in the morning (opted out of buffet). Rooftop bar was good, with a decent selection of beverages.

title: Stay in NYC at M Social
text: Had a great time in NYC as it re-opens. M Social is a great hotel convenient to everything NYC. Staff was great, accomodations were very good. Helpful at check-in and check-out and getting cabs to airport froour departure.  Very appreciative for their hospitality

title: Fab location, excellent stay
text:
We had a lovely 5 night stay here last week. The whole hotel was so clean and our room refreshed every day. The room was really spacious too with great views of the Hudson and the bed was massive and so comfy, I had a better nights sleep than at home!  Staff were friendly and accommodating, nothing was too much trouble. No kettle in the room which was my only slight disappointment as I love a cup of tea before bed and in the morning but when I thought to ask, they brought one up for me. 
I booked through booking.com and the fees were all included. They even give the $10 per night destination fee back to you as bar credit which we took full use of, especially sitting on the roof terrace overlooking time square in the sunshine! Overall, a great stay, would definitely stay here again and highly recommend, especially as the price is so reasonable for what you get and the fact you are in Times Square.
Location is great, We got the Air train from JFK then the Subway straight to 7th ave.  walked one block down and one block over to the hotel door. (no lift at 7th ave so had to get the suitcases up the steps, some lovely gent helped me up which was very welcome!) It's also only a minute walk from the hotel door to Times Square station.

title: Disappointed
text:
First of all the photos on the website bear no resemblance to the actual rooms. I paid for a Times Square Premier Room. There was nothing premier about it. The carpets are worn, the bathroom was tiny and needed a good clean. There were no tea/coffee making facilities. It did not feel like a four star hotel - more like a tired travelodge.

On the plus side the view from the room was fabulous.

The lobby and bar area were quite frantic - I’m not sure what market the hotel is aiming at - is it families, couples or young people?

The biggest problem was the noise at night from other rooms. We called security on the last night at midnight and they came and asked the occupants to keep the noise down - whilst the noise was lowered the selfish occupant thought it appropriate to crank up the music again at 2am. Whilst I appreciate this is not the hotel’s fault it did mean that we had very little sleep during our 3 night stay.

Location wise it is well situated but since NYC has legalised cannabis everywhere around the hotel were weed shops and people off their faces on drugs. Times Square is returning to its bad days and therefore the hotel’s location is probably now a minus rather than a plus point.

So I would not recommend this hotel and will not be returning.

title: Amazing place and location
text: It’s a great place. I will be back for sure. Amazing staff and service. Great location and clean. The subway station just right there. I recommend this hotel for first time visitors. All best places in New York are close.

title: Vacay with kiddos
text: Great location, wonderful view, responsive friendly staff. Went for spring break, kids loved the patio overlooking time Square. Beds were small to share but as expected in NYC. Overall would definitely stay here again

title: Our new go-to in NYC
text: The location can't be beat and I really like that the check in is up and away from street-level.  It makes it feel a bit more secure.  I would say that they need to work on getting more lifts to the main lobby though as it can be quite a wait if you have bags and are arriving at a busy time.  In addition to a great location I found the check-in staff particularly friendly.  Personable and efficient often a tough balance, but the person checking us in definitely got it right.  I have recommended this hotel to everyone that has asked us as we have been to NYC often and have stayed at various hotels.  This is our new go-to in NYC.

title: Complete scam
text:
DO NOT stay at this hotel if you don’t want to be scammed out of money . I booked this hotel as part of British Airways holidays, which at time of booking included all taxes and fees (or so I thought). My stay was 7 nights.

On arrival to hotel I was immediately asked to pay $700 deposit (which was reduced to $500 as a goodwill gesture) and a resort “tax” of $40 a night was also applicable. I have never had to pay such a high deposit at a hotel (my friend was staying across the road at the Sheraton and paid $50 deposit for the minibar .. and that was it) 

I argued why a resort “tax” was applicable.. the front office staff could barely give a valid reason and said it covered many things such as Wi-Fi and a bar discount (Wi-Fi is already complimentary for members of the public who can walk in, so this was complete nonsense). The hotel rooms don’t even have a minibar or a basic coffee machine .. so a $40 fee per night was laughable. 

I was told that the fee would give me $10 credit at the hotel bar per day .. I used this 5 times which totalled $50. I was assured this would be debited from my total bill at the end of the stay. Thankfully, I asked for an itemised bill, and surprise surprise.. the $50 credit was not applied to my bill. The front desk had to manually apply it , but only when I pointed it out . It was very obvious that this practice is carried out to scam foreign visitors. 

It’s a sad situation that a nice hotel in a great location tries to purposely scam visitors like this . Don’t make the same mistake as I did .. book another hotel nearby that doesn’t use illegal fees.

title: Great view. Small beds.
text: We stayed for 3 nights. The room was a decent size but the bed was definitely too small for two adults to sleep in comfortably. Otherwise it was clean, well maintained, and up to date. Loved the view of Times Square. It was a decent walking distance too. I was afraid of the noise at night but it was fine, couldn’t really hear anything. The breakfast was ok (not included). I think there were other amenities that we didn’t use because we have a 9 year old with us. Overall it was a good place to stay.

title: Great property...great location...well worth the value!
text: My survey of this property was exceptional.  My criticism was minimal (need for more (brighter) lighting in room).  I will add the interior elevator bank was consistently slow, given there were four cars.  Other than that, terrific staff, the room was stylish and perfectly suitable for our (couple) needs.  Some might say the bathrooms are small, but again, most suitable for our needs.

title: Best hotel in time square
text: Truly a hidden gem in Manhattan along with our housekeeper Evelina she made our stay feel like we were at home. She treated us like family and is a true gem. If your looking for a welcoming place to stay in New York stay at the M Social.

title: Good not great!
text: Location is very close to Timesquare.  Not easy to grab a taxi from.  Breakfast is buffet at $27 pp it’s ok.  Room service was pretty good.  Staff was good but could be better.  Making the guest feel welcomed would have helped.  Two elevators so it does take time to get to the lobby when it’s busy.  You stay here for the view and where it’s located that’s pretty much it no wow factor other than that.

title: Great choice to stay in NY
text: The view was fantastic! The room was great and very spacious in the modern decor. The location was unbeatable, right in the middle of Time Square. Staff was helpful and friendly. I definitely recommend!

title: Great stay for family or romantic getaway
text: Our stay was amazing. We stayed a week. Room service options were fantastic. Hotel lobby had lots of amenities for kids and adults. Free shuffleboard, foosball, video games, multiple televisions. The bar is fully stocked so you can order anything from wine to beer to cocktails. Charge to the room is always available for bar or restaurant. There is also a small shop in the lobby in case you need snacks, drinks, or gifts. Though for groceries there is a Walgreens just below the hotel if you don’t want to pay the hiked up prices. That was also very handy. The location can’t be beat either. Right in the middle of downtown Manhattan. You can walk to 5th Ave, Rockefeller Center, any Broadway show or Central Park. Subway access just outside as well if you want to go a bit further. Plenty of dining options immediately surrounding the hotel as well. It’s about 2 blocks from times square. Rooms are great even if you don’t spring for the high floor / times square view option. Large screened TV. Beds are firm and comfortable. There is no microwave or coffee and the fridge is quite small so don’t plan to keep any leftovers. The drink will accommodate a few small drinks. Shower is amazing! Rain style ceiling mounted head and a wall mounted wand. Water pressure was great as was heat. Full sized mirror with light ring. Free wifi during your entire stay. Overall I really enjoyed my stay and my family and I remarked several times about how perfect the hotel and location was for our trip.

title: Good hotel
text: This hotel was just right for our first trip to NYC. It is in the middle of the theater district, so we walked to our shows in 10 minutes or less. Avoid room 902 & 904 and that vicinity. The live DJ at the bar and people coming onto the rooftop bar for pics and screaming kept us awake. It was just one night that that happened. It certainly won’t keep me from returning to this hotel. Just be aware.

title: Perfect place
text: The hotel was very well kept and clean. The lobby was awesome and had lots of comfortable and diverse seating. There were a couple of games there too. The staff were all very kind and friendly.  I lived the location because it was slightly off the center of Times Square. Not as crowded.

title: Amazing Stay
text: Such a nice hotel! Being that it was in NYC the hotel room was so spacious! They regularly cleaned the rooms, had a great view of Times Square. The location is amazing! Everything was walking distance. The only thing was that the elevators got a bit congested at times but nothing major. Will definitely be coming back and staying here in the future.

title: No…oh and then NO!!!
text:
Seriously the reviews who said this hotel was ‘great’ are delirious. 

Let’s start with the good:

1) location: great location 

2) rooftop bar : awesome view (sub average bar that smells like a dive bar with one bartender in the middle of spring break) 

We arrive at 11 am to the reception employee yelling (yes YELLING) at a foreign man. The employee was so angry and unprofessional. You either smell pot or petroli oil. 

Our room wasn’t ready…we have our day and arrive back at 330. Room ready. Average room. Hallways/elevators are dingy and boarder line dirty. Carpets are literally gross, stains everywhere. 

We arrive in room, no wash cloths. Really? I call house keeping and am told there are NO wash clothes because of the ‘pandemic’ (which is allegedly over since you’re not making me wear a mask) and they’ll ‘try’ and find me one. 

We are still here. If we could check our I would. We picked this last minute after canceled flights and arriving 2 days later than expected which only left us one day in the city. 

Unless your 20 something and don’t care stay away.

title: Great Times Square view!!
text: My wife and I went for our 10th anniversary of marriage. It was a great Experience. The hotel is very well centrally located to get to broadway shows, times square, central park, La Guardia airport is 30 min, the service was always great, Overall great experience!

title: A really nice hotel
text: We really liked our stay at Msocial hotel Times square. The staff was very nice, helpful and servicemided. Wonderful wiews in the restaurang and of course good food, so it was a pleasure to eat there. Evelina cleaned our room very good and was so nice. I will recommend this hotell!  it is a realaxing atmosphere with good service and big rooms. Birgitta and Nils from Sweden

title: Beautiful hotel, excellent location
text: I booked 2 rooms for a short stay, was very pleased.  Everything was perfect.  All employees were very nice and welcoming. The hotel is even more beautiful in person. It was my first stay in NYC and when I get another chance, I'll stay here again. The rooms were comfortable in size and very clean.  The views are spectacular!

title: Un séjour de rêve avec vue sur Times Square!
text: Excellent hôtel, propreté impeccable, à deux pas de Times Square, le restaurant de l'hôtel donne une vue imprenable sur Times Square en plus d'être très joli, le service chaleureux, courtois, les lits confortables, belle chambre, bref, un magnifique séjour mère - filles de 3 nuitées! Je recommande vivement cet hôtel! J'y retournerais demain matin.

title: A true gem of a hotel1
text: It's my second time staying at the M Social Hotel Times Square. Everything about this hotel is great. I highly recommend the hotel to everyone visiting NYC! The view is spectacular. The lobby is colorful and welcoming. The staff are great. The rooms are quiet and clean.

title: Excellent hôtel
text: Emplacement idéal pour visiter New York. Proche métro, Times Square. A quelques blocs de central parc. Très bon séjour. Très bon accueil au lobby. Ayant un départ très tôt le matin, Le concierge avait bien réservé un taxi à l’heure et au tarif indiqué.

title: Great hotel in a central location, would stay here again
text:
Really solid hotel in a great location 

Hudson views from the 29th floor were excellent

Staff helped book us a taxi every day and even helped us book a premium taxi on our trip to the airport

Bar and lobby area has a chilled out feel with comfortable seating and games to play

Food and drink at the hotel is expensive but that's up to you, there are plenty of other places to eat nearby 

We recommend the bakery opposite the hotel Angelinas for a snack

title: Stay in the heart of Manhattan
text: I enjoyed my stay to the fullest. The hotel is super located, it’s in the heart of Manhattan. Staff is very friendly, kind and helpful. The view from the hotel room is absolutely fabulous. I highly recommend this place!

title: Amazing location
text: Perfect location for exploring New York. Times Square is on the doorstep with its abundance of bars and restaurants, and Hells Kitchen and 8th and 9th are a short walk away. Central Park is a 10 minute walk and there are multiple subway stations nearby giving easy access to anywhere in the city.

title: Outstanding
text:
We travelled to NYC on the 17th of February. 
Tired after a long plane journey we arrived at the M Social Manhattan. 
We booked through a 3rd party website & for some reason they could not find our booking on the front desk.
This could have been a pain but Stella on the front desk, sorted it out so quickly for us. Not only that, she told us to have a seat in the lobby & gave our 2 sons a toy yellow taxi each to play with while we waited. Such a nice touch & they were thrilled with their gift. 
So Stella sorted our room and because of the “inconvenience” (10 minute wait) also upgraded our room from the 12th floor to the 29th. Already, we felt like our business was wanted in the hotel & we couldn’t have felt more welcome. 
We got to our room & oh my God- the view overlooking Times Square was unbelievable. 
Rooms were extremely clean & a good size for Manhattan. 
The next morning we had breakfast in the hotel. One of our sons is autistic with a very limited diet. 
We explained this to the staff & they had no problem whatsoever with him having his own breakfast cereal we had brought with us- in fact, they even gave us hot milk every morning for it. After the 1st day we didn’t even have to ask for it. 
The Breakfast buffet was delicious with so much choice & really set us up for the day. It was great value as well. 
Carlos was our waiter every day for our breakfast & what a nice guy he was. Even when they were busy he & all the other wait staff were so friendly and welcoming. 
The lobby had such a cool child friendly zone. Games console with gaming chairs, foosball table and other games. My sons loved it. Really chilled out vibe & felt safe to let the kids play away. 
It also has such a cool rooftop terrace which I’m sure would be amazing to sit out on in warmer months. 
I would have no hesitation in recommending the hotel to any type of traveler, family, couples, friends, business etc. 
Thank you to the M Social, in particular Stella & Carlos for making our first family trip to NYC an unforgettable experience.

title: Disappointing
text: The only good from this hotel is the location. Given what they charge a night it is not worth it. I booked on a third party sight and the discount was not enough to what we got. I appreciated the view of time square but that’s all I enjoyed about the room. Stayed two nights and would not have survived staying here any longer. My advise search elsewhere, you’ll thank me later. Also providing pictures of the condition of the room. Pictures do not reflect what is online. Lamp had finger prints and didn’t turn on. Rust in bathroom sink. Broken tile in bathroom. Dirty bathtub floor. Dust everywhere. Closet DIRTY. I stayed on the 22nd floor and overall completely disappointed.

title: BOOK THIS NOW!
text:
Amazing appointments abound in this hidden gem close to all that is New York. Modern vibes with an added family flare. Highly recommend and will visit again SOON!

Spectacular atrium with plenty of seats for chilling, a gorgeous breakfast buffet and bar right in the hotel. Coffee shop too.

title: Would not recommend!
text: This hotel is bare bones expectations of a hotel. Missing even basics like a coffee machine in the room. The quality of what was there was sub par like the hair dryer that barely blew hot air. The rooms are clean-ish and its a good location but weigh your options and spend your money wisely if you are interested in a real 4 star hotel.

title: charges were terrible beware
text:
I thought we had paid all the taxes or at least some the Hotel charged us an extortionate amount on top per day.
Destination Fee $35 per day
Destination fee sales tax $3.11
Destination fee city tax $2.06
That was $40.17 x 4 Total of $160.68

$160.68 charges We had already paid in pounds £86.76 ( about $118 approx) on our booking surely nearly $280 cannot be right for 4 days tax and extra charges surely this must be a mistake ? please can you look into this please I am so upset I was a hard working one parent taking her daughter for her 18th please can you look into the booking and check why I paid tax and charges both ends.

title: Amazing Room
text:
This hotel is perfectly located if you want to be close to the theater district, time square, etc.  Nearby subway stops make it easy to get anywhere in town and the restaurant has a great view of Time Square.

What I really loved was the room.  For a NYC hotel, the rooms were spacious and even better--very well insulated for sound.  So often you hear street noise and/or people in the hall and that was never an issue during my 3 night stay here.

Highly recommend the M Social if you are heading to NYC and need a hotel in that area.

title: The Great Stay
text: I’ll start by saying this hotel is beautiful. The location is great and the view was AMAZING!  I have absolutely nothing bad to say about my stay. The staff was kind, professional and super accommodating. The room was nice and comfy with a beautiful ambience. The food was great and I will definitely stay her again.

title: First time in NYC
text: From the moment I got to the hotel, the concierge was there to meet me, all staff are very professional and made my first trip very pleasant. The property is gorgeous, rooms are top notch. I will definitely be back.

title: Excellent Stay
text:
Arrived on 4th Feb 2022 for 3 night stay finally being able to travel again after 3 years.  Check in was a breeze we were in room 2208 and you could see Times Square from our window (just).  King size bed was comfortable and shower facilities were really nice, Room is fitted with black out curtains so you won't get disturbed by the lights of Time Square

Hotel bar is lovely although could do with Bud and or Bud Light on draught and is quite expensive but the bar servers were all excellent and made the wife some cocktails which were not on their menu.

All of the staff that dealt with us were excellent, friendly and very cooperative, nothing was too much trouble for anyone.

The location of the hotel is on Times Square and from the roof top bar on NYE you would be able to see the ball drop from there.

When we left the guys at the door looked after our cases for our last few hours taking in the sights and arranged for a cab to take us to JFK in time for our check in.

Although our stay was short and only 3 nights it was excellent from the moment we arrived to the minute we left.  I would definitely stay here again and I would also recommend it to anyone.

title: So Posh!
text: Such a beautiful, swanky hotel in the heart of Times Square! The overall customer service of this hotel was A1...from the seamless check in to the awesome service in the restaurant. I was very impressed! We had the perfect room that had the perfect view of Times Square. The bright city lights just never get old. I can't wait to visit again! The photo attached is from the outdoor terrace. Amazing!

title: Great location and great lighting!
text: A lot of places I've stayed recently have too few lights that are not well placed.  M Social is the place to stay if you need to read or work.  Lights and outlets everywhere you need them.  It also has a great location.  Walking distance to many sites and a nearby subway station.  Bathroom did have some mold in the grout.

title: Vue sur Times Square et service excellent
text: L'espace déjeuner sur Times Square, le personnel et les services sont des atouts indéniables pour ce lieu où vous aurez un accès privilégié sur le tout NY. N'oubliez le petit selfie sur Broadway. Les théâtres, le subway et la 5e sont à deux pas. Les chambre sont confortables et très bien équipées. Enjoy !

title: Ok.
text: Average… staff service needs is just ok. Restaurant doesn’t have much options. Bar and service staff - very good. Great location. Clean rooms. Good views of  the city. Slow elevator during check-out. Leave early on the day of your check-out. Overall it was an ok stay.

title: Nice hotel with some issues
text: So to start with due to weather we had to leave a day early at the last minute, and ended up having to be chaperones for some students for the night.  The hotel was very accommodating in getting us taken care of with getting us an extra room for the 1 night across from each other, and for letting us keep the kids bags in their luggage storage till we got them checked into their hotel.  Hugh thank you for all of that.  Our booked room was nice, had a good view of Time Square that we wanted.  Bed was nice, room had good amount of space, the bathroom had a big shower but rest of bathroom was small.  The housekeeping was very good too.  The only issues we that you had to use 2 different elevators to get to ground level, which there was usually a line from lobby to ground.  The other issue was the bar.  For some reason the outside was closed (maybe too cold or windy, but could never find out why), they were pricey drinks, either didn't know how to make various drinks or didn't have the ingredients to do so, and I'm not talking about very new or very obscure drinks (I was ordering painkillers, zombies, tropical stuff), and once I found a drink they could do, it wasn't exactly right ( never seen a green rum punch) it tasted ok but wasn't really what I wanted, esp for the price.  The bar is the main reason it gets 4 and not 5 stars.

title: Time Sq Hotel with lovely views
text:
Wonderful hotel! Right in the middle of the city! The room was perfect….very cozy. 

The hotel has a nice bar in the lobby with a great ambiance. There was a Dj when we arrived after dinner. Drinks and dinner was delicious. 

We had breakfast in the morning with a wonderful view of time sq. The staff was wonderful and provided great service.

Highly recommend!!!!!

title: Great hotel, love the photo booth!
text: Great hotel, nice views at the restaurant, fantastic service! Nice ambience at the lobby area, they have a DJ by the restaurant and a nice photo booth in the lobby, games. Plenty of things to do to at this hotel. I will be back!!!

title: Thrilled with this hotel
text: I felt overwhelmed with the hotel options when booking my first stay in Manhattan, but was thrilled with my experience at M Social! My room had an incredible view of Times Square - just what I wanted. The staff was courteous and quick, location was perfect for a tourist, my room was updated, clean, and quiet. Will be recommending!

title: Wonderful experience
text: I had a wonderful experience on M Social Hotel. A really great staff, very attentive and willing to help. The location is perfect, and the view of time square is fantastic. Special thanks to Adasha Lockhart, from manangement. Highly recommended

title: Bon rapport qualité prix
text:
Ancien novotel. Très bonne situation et literie confortable. Un tout grand merci à evelina pour sa bonne humeur et son efficacité dans les chambres . Notre rayon de soleil a NYC.
Petit déjeuner moyen et pas de la même qualité que celui du novotel

title: great hotel!
text: excellent location, great room space and the view was awesome too. i loved this hotel and would come back anytime i come back to nyc. i would have loved to have a microwave or coffee maker in the room but its not that big of a deal. walking distance to times square without being too loud. wish the restaurant at the hotel had a better diversity in meals

title: No quieren hablar nada español y dentro de sus servicios dice que hablan español
text:
Hola qué tal buenas tardes

Mi calificación espero cambiarla después de la estancia pero la razón por la que la calificó así es por que cuando hice mi reservación ahí decía que se hablaban español sin embargo me comuniqué y por más de que le insistía la señorita no me buscó a nadie que hablar español entonces por favor no pongan dentro de los servicios del hotel que hablan este idioma.

El motivo de mi llamada era para verificar que mi reserva estuviera bien hecha ya que la hice por medio de Expedia  y no quiero llegar y pasar un mal rato pero por lo poco que le entendí a una señorita llamada Michelle o Sharon algo así es que no hay nadie que hable español. Deben de quitar que hablan este idioma ya que se niegan a buscar a alguien que nos puede entender

title: New York Family Vacation
text: Our experience started great, the front desk man gave us our room early and upgraded at no additional cost.  Later that evening Vietta was not helpful when we asked about amenities. She was very dry and would just nod instead of answering.  However, we had the absolutely best dinning experience. Carlos and Armando were very friendly and helpful during all of our dinning experiences.  Thank you Carlos and Armando for making our vacation experience great.

title: . Great hotel in the heart of Times Square.
text: Upscale fun hotel with onsite dining and bar. The bar has a great lounge area with big screens, games and well thought out spaces to relax after a long day. The restaurant is good with beautiful views of Broadway and Times Square. Great cocktails

title: Nice views
text:
Muy buenas vistas en los cuartos con camas super cómodas. Cuarto super limpió, una excelente ubicación.
100% recomendado si deseas pasar unas vacaciones en el corazón de New York. Volvería sin pensarlo!

title: Excelente ubicaciòn para visitar  New York
text:
Excelente lugar, servicio y precio. Una vista espectacular a toda la 5ta avenida y time square. Agua caliente, tv, nevera. Buen dormir. Definitivamente volveria a quedarme aqui. 
10 dolares para consumo en bar diario.

title: Great sleep, great location
text: Came to NYC for theatre, so I chose this hotel for its location and price at the time of booking. Good proximity to a subway station that’s not too crowded. Walking distance to all theatres. Had a king size bed. Room was in great working order. Lighting could use some improvement — felt a little dark but adequate enough. Great shower. Best sleep I’ve gotten in a hotel in ages. I didn’t use the lobby bar but it seemed like it had plenty of seating and would make for a nice evening in. Nice energetic vibe without being overwhelming. I would stay here again if the price is right.

title: Satisfait de notre choix d’hôtel
text:
Nous avons eu une belle vue de la chambre et de la terrasse.
La décoration du lobby est moderne.
La chambre ainsi que la salle de bain étaient bien.
Nous y étions pour 2 nuits et quand on est à New York c’est pour visiter pas pour rester à l’hôtel et cet hôtel convenait très bien pour cela.

title: Excellent stay
text: Great experience. First time staying a MSocial and won't be my last.    Best accommodations,  Social King was large and comfortable.  Great for working, large desk area and nice chaise for relaxing.  Stayed on a high floor, nice city view.  Staff was always friendly and accommodating.

title: Hotel Close to Times Square
text: The location of the hotel is excellent. The room is quiet on the 26th Floor. The bathroom is quite small. Shower head can be better. The room was semi good. There was 2 trashes that was missed. The desk next to the bed was not wiped down. The fridge has no freezer part. And it dirty. The bed is comfortable and the pillows is comfy. Will I stay here again. Probably not.

title: Great Property.  Convenient Location.
text: Very nice upbeat hotel in a very convenient location.  Nearby restaurants.  Can easily walk to Broadway and Times Square.  Clean rooms. Rooms were very quiet.  Decor is very modern and nice.  Lobby bar looked fun although we didn't use it.

title: Great hotel
text:
My Daughter and myself stayed here after the hotel that we had booked and arrived at (Riu) had overbooked.  The reception staff were very friendly, relaxed and helpful, (when we arrived tired and upset). The breakfast room, food and team were just great, amazing view from here.  The bar area had a good atmosphere and the outdoor area, although too cold to sit out, looks like it would be fab in better weather.  
The bedrooms were spacious, very clean, really comfortable.  I couldn’t fault it and would choose to stay here again.  We were gutted when we transferred to the Riu for the last 2 nights, the Riu was poor in comparison.
Thankyou for your hospitality x

title: Un peu déçu
text:
Déçu par rapport aux séjours précédents du temps novotel
Chambre belle vue et calme mais aurait besoin de quelques travaux 
Pas de bouteille eau 
Hall d entrée très bruyant pas très envie d y rester malgré la déco sympa
Petit déjeuner assez banal 
Par contre réception et concierge très sympa et aidant
